1300 hours in, and I've done every quest in the game. All that's left is the piss-poor PvP options or endless grinding of instances. The new party finder is an absolute wreck as it's not intuitive. On release, this was an open-world pvP game that rapidly devolved into a mish-mash of PvP/PvE and hella bugs in story. The crafting system is the worst grind: frequently 1250 mats needed to raise skill a pip or two, then back out to harvest for hours or buy off of the player-run server-specific trading post which is an absolute free-for-all of end-stage Capitalism at its finest. The 'expansion' is a DLC that allows five more levels, mounts, and  anew zone - about 8 hours of actual game play. 

The world is stunning but buggy as all-git-out. I recommend New World for a decent story, rich NPCs and a gorgeous world... but it's laggy and buggy as Hell at times, with AZG taking over five weeks to fix bugs in MSQ or even the launcher. All in all, if you pay your 50 bucks and get your 40 or 50 hours of story in, you've done just about everything there is save the end-game grinding of 8 or 9 dungeons/instances that you may or may not find a group for based on your in-game gearing.

Pros:

1. Immersive World Design: The game's rendition of Aeternum, a mysterious island filled with ancient ruins and supernatural forces, is breathtaking. From lush forests to desolate beaches and eerie swamps, each environment feels meticulously crafted and invites exploration.

2. Engaging Combat System: "New World" offers a refreshing take on MMO combat with its action-oriented mechanics. Players must carefully time their attacks, blocks, and dodges, adding a layer of skill-based gameplay to encounters with both AI enemies and other players.

3. Player-driven Economy: The game's economy is entirely player-driven, allowing for a dynamic marketplace where prices fluctuate based on supply and demand. Crafting professions such as blacksmithing, woodworking, and alchemy play a crucial role, fostering a sense of community as players trade resources and goods.

4. Territorial Warfare: One of the game's standout features is its territorial warfare system, where players can join factions and vie for control over settlements scattered across the island. Large-scale battles involving siege weapons and fortifications offer thrilling PvP (Player vs. Player) experiences.

5. Continuous Development: Amazon Games has demonstrated a commitment to improving and expanding the game post-launch through regular updates and patches. New content, including features like expeditions and seasonal events, keeps the experience fresh for players.

Cons:

1. Lackluster Quest Design: Despite the immersive world, quest design often feels repetitive and uninspired. Many quests boil down to simple fetch or kill tasks, failing to offer meaningful narrative or gameplay variety.

2. Grind-heavy Progression: Progression in "New World" can feel excessively grindy, especially at higher levels. Players are required to invest significant time and effort into leveling up skills, acquiring resources, and completing repetitive tasks to advance.

3. Technical Issues: The game's launch was marred by technical issues, including server instability, long queue times, and performance optimization problems. While some of these issues have been addressed post-launch, occasional bugs and glitches still persist, but they are working on it.

4. Balance Concerns: Balancing issues plague certain aspects of the game, particularly in PvP combat and faction warfare. Certain weapons and abilities may feel overpowered or underwhelming, leading to frustration among players seeking fair and competitive gameplay.

5. Limited Endgame Content: Despite its promising start, "New World" currently lacks substantial endgame content beyond territorial warfare and repetitive PvE activities. Without meaningful progression or rewards to pursue, some players may find themselves at a loss once they reach max level.

Conclusion:
"New World" presents a captivating vision of exploration, combat, and community-driven gameplay set against the backdrop of a mysterious and dangerous island. While it excels in certain areas such as world design and combat mechanics, it falls short in others, including quest variety and endgame content. Despite its flaws, "New World" remains a promising MMO with the potential for further growth and refinement through ongoing updates and community feedback. Whether it can realize its full potential and carve out a lasting legacy in the MMO genre remains to be seen.

[h1] New World [/h1] 
New World falls short of expectations. Despite its promising concept, the gameplay feels repetitive and lacks depth. The game suffers from technical issues and balancing problems, leading to frustration among players. If you're seeking a polished MMO experience, you may want to look elsewhere.

It's unfortunate when something with so much potential is squandered to the extent that this game has been by the developers. The combat is easily better than other big MMOs. After 2 years, the game hasn't improved, and many people may argue that it's actually gotten worse.

A beautiful game. I'm amazed how smoothly it's running. They did have queue issues that have been addressed with additional servers. To be fair they didn't anticipate everyone buying it. The pre-sales were average. Most folks didn't get the pre-sale. The game is a challenge. I really do appreciate an MMO where crafting matters. Very few MMOs make crafting worth anything. In this one crafted armor is awesome and challenging. Crafting and harvesting can mean life or death for a city. 

(IMHO Most MMOs failed at crafting. Crafted gear should always be better than dungeon, and raid etc. You shouldn't get the best gear from a fight. Realistically the gear you would get would be in tatters after you beat the crap out of the boss. Now, having a high enough crafting skill should let you deconstruct destroyed armor and make a recipe for it. Dungeons and Raids should drop recipes, mats, lore, etc., not push someone to OP)

So yes, there is a grind because crafting and harvesting matters. Quests from factions and the town work with the grind so you're at least getting something other than mats out of it. The area perks are nice and I do enjoy the story. The music is calming and skills matter. A lot of thought went into the game. There's a current debate over mounts being added. Personally I don't think they're needed. A few more of the warping shrines would be good though.

UPDATE 2.24.24

Still stand by my initial post. The game has only improved. Mounts have been added as well as the flail. It's very hard for me to be bored with the game. Crafting is still essential. (One of the main reasons I'm loyal.)

Been here since launch, stopped playing 2 months after because i wanted to play different stuff. Came back at the fresh server launch and it wasnt the launch day experience again but it was a well deserve improved.

Now, launch day even after all the bugs (that i personally didnt suffer much), the bots all the normal problems mmorpgs get. It was the most fun i had in a launch day i ever had, i've met so many players in my company that even after everyone stoppedd playing or changed servers i still remember their names.

The fresh server roll around, i went in with a no dedication to it in mind, did enjoy it not has much has the launch it self but the leveling experience improved greatly.

Personal pros and cons:
- Combat: i love the combat in this game it feels active and rewarding the hitboxes and register hits can be a bit hiffy with aoe melee stuff but overall i love the combat and its one of the main attractions for me
- Crafting system - crafting in mmorpgs and grinding the resources always been appealing to me and hitting all the caps its rewarding for me. But i know full well that for most people it just feels like a grocery list 
- Open world - this game is beautiful sometimes i just look at some POI's when the light hits just right! Even brimstone that i didnt enjoy earlier on because its desert and not my thing is growing on me the more time i spend on it
- Weapon System - the way you can mix match weapons that scale on the same attribute open up a lot of different builds that you can have fun with

Cons:
- Late Game: not a problem for me but i recognize how most people see it, theres a lack of stuff to do besides either PvP like races, opr, arenas (that got absolutly nerfed to shit coz the devs want to push OPR since its getting mounts in season 5), and wars if you get a good company and get into one. Oh and chest runs that can be get boring if you do them daily but hey you can get cool stuff to make gold from them so thats something riiiiggghht??
- Gearing late game - BIS items can be a bitch to get either from a crafting perspective or buying, anyways requires some sort of farming and changing builds can be expensive too so get a good feel for all the weapons the game has before commiting 

TLDR you like grinding and some action packed pvp with a good company on discord? go for it, i have the most fun when im just fooling around with my company mates
If you get bored of repetite tasks or playing the same popular pvp mode that is OPR (20v20)

[h3]EDIT after 501 hrs and it's Feb 2024:[/h3] No longer recommend this game. Has great bones and exceptionally fun combat but the devs are completely inept- almost as if they don't even play their own game. Making sweeping updates to combat when it takes weeks or months (depending on how much you play) to grind and/or craft gear does not respect the player's time; you could spend a month trying to get a specific piece of gear/wep to drop and they overnerf a single ability, rendering your entire set useless. They nerf already under-performing weapons yet ignored overpowered weapons. They've completely ignored the PvP crowd which is weird as it's a huge part of the game. There are two modes, 3v3 and OPR, neither which have had new maps/modes released and there's no PvP roadmap so who knows. The faction system encourages factions to simp for each other- green teams up with yellow, purp is outnumbered and vise versa which IS NOT FUN in open-world combat. No skirmish system for wars so good luck experiencing that aspect of PvP if you're not part of a larger company. Most of the servers are dominated by gold-buying/selling war loggers who don't even play regularly, they just log on for wars to continue their long, long reign on the server; it's very difficult for other companies, if they're not also war loggers, to challenge them as they have so much gold built up they can BiS gear their entire roster and any mercs who fight for them. They will pay the best PvP players in the other factions to switch, making both war and open-world PvP extremely one-sided and boring. 

I had a lot of fun for my 501 hours but I just can't recommend this game anymore asI don't think it's heading in a good direction.
Game lack of content dept and suffers from huge amount of technical issues, instead of publishing a half baked product, should focus on fixing everthing and delivering more meaninful content.

Beware before buying this game. It has no real endgame. Some people will claim "pvp is endgame" which would completely invalidate the need of trade skills & dungeons.

The "endgame" in New World contains two things
- Mutated Dungeons
- Elite Chest Runs

Most of the "Best In Slot" gear is craftable or timegated bought items (you can upgrade named items with 3 chromatic seals that you can buy for in-game currency - 1 per day). You rarely get BiS gear out of dungeons, pvp or Elite Chest runs

If you plan to craft your own items buckle up for a senseless grind against bots because all ressources are globally shared.
And bots is not the problem, there are even people that afk-autoscript farm certain ressources for days

Edit 3 months later: Changed to a negative review.
 - Rampant duping exploits ruined the in game economy (they have fixed about 10 different dupe exploits by now but there are still plenty in the game). Dupers got a slap on the wrist with 24 hour bans. 
  - Nerfs to increase the XP grind were applied to new players but not people who already leveled. 
  - PVP wars being won through exploits like dragging your game around in windowed mode to make yourself invincible. Or mass reporting the enemy team to trigger instant automatic bans (this is after the devs promised that all bans were manually reviewed and carefully applied. lol). Or the lag exploits that make you invincible to damage by spamming AOE spells. Or the getting out of spawn early before the timer ends exploit. 
  - Dev team constantly puts out patches that they didn't think through, only to reverse them later, while introducing new bugs in the process. 
  - AGS is unable to deal with bots so they do things like nerf fishing profession until it's useless.

While by no means perfect, they've managed to capture the old school fun of exploring the world.  The whole "what's that over there?" feeling that has been missing from MMOs for the last decade or so.  While this does create an engaging and interesting feel, what brings me back to the game is how the desire to explore is rewarded with vistas, critters, loot, or crafting nodes that make getting 'over there' worth it.

At this point, I'm 174 hours in without having done any, and I mean, ANY group content.  I'm too distracted with running around, beating up badguys, following a pretty interesting story, and collecting everything I see. It is fun. It is not perfect.  But, they are constantly working to make it better, so... I'd say it's worth what they are asking for it.  Hop in, grab your favorite weapon, and stick a baddie with it! XD

New World is obviously a game that was created with a large bank roll thanks to Amazon backing up the brinks truck to the studio's doors. I can recommend if you are interested in exploring a really great looking environment, enjoy crafting, can enjoy "the journey" to quote an old WOW streamer or if you are a PVPer. There is no monthly sub so it's worth trying and you should do so sooner rather than later as the dwindling server populations will likely convince Amazon to kill off the game before too much longer. For the record, I'd really like to see them turn it around and succeed but it definitely feels like a sinking ship.

The good/bad:

The good:
- The graphics as far as landscapes are great, especially for an MMO and obviously a lot of time and money went into creating those landscapes. 

- The sounds are fantastic, chopping a tree, mining ore and bard music all sounds really good. Zone music is average.

-The leveling experience is good yet confusing at times, probably my favorite part of the game.

- The voice acting is well done though simple.

- Gathering professions are actually a little bit fun, still a grind but it's interesting that the trees fall down and bushes disappear... and respawn shortly after. But a nice touch none the less.

- Melee feels strong, which is odd for a game with magic and guns. But I like having the choice to go that route.

- Jump puzzles are interesting

CONS:

-Plenty of Ocean, lakes and rivers but no swimming?!?! who the hell decided THAT was a good idea?

-Only 3 character slots...WHY?

- The character creation portion of the game is very limited. Probably the worst I've seen in a major MMO in 20 years? You are able to select from two body types (basic male\female). There are about 20 preset faces most of which look weird with eyes too close together, cross eyed and other odd proportions, none of which can be changed. They have around 20 awful hairstyles to choose from, picking one is like picking which president to vote for... which is the least awful. Facial hair is pretty good, they look better than most other games. Eye colors have a decent variety and some odd choices like purple. Skin colors are snow white, various shades of jaundice yellow and a couple each for brown and midnight black. Lastly you can choose from around 5 scars and accessories but half of them you cant see.

- Jumping is really not jumping, it's hopping or maybe skipping.

- New players seem to be shunned by a lot of level gated content, some is the standard dungeons and such but "seasons" which are similar to holiday events are oddly level gated.

- Not enough weapon choices for a game that puts so much emphasis on active combat. I went into the game thinking i wanted to play a samurai but quickly found out I was stuck with whatever they gave me (sword and board) I thought ok maybe later but alas, no dual wielding? There went my next idea for a back stabbing rogue... Finally I decided to try a cleric or paladin type. That also didn't work out well as I had to constantly switch weapons to be able to heal. I eventually settled on letting the game's RNG decide what my playstyle should be and that worked out better.

-EVERY name you've ever used, thought of using or could possibly consider using, is taken. Trust me, I've tried several different languages, spellings etc. and the only way to get a name you can deal with is to have either a surname or put random characters in your name. This goes for character names and company(guild) names.

- I have seen very little gear in the game that I like, you'll ALWAYS look like a dumpster fire. So if you like looking good, too bad, you can't even buy decent looking gear.

- combat is annoying as hell. One issue with combat is if there is a height difference between you and your target (fighting on a hill) you will miss point blank many times. doesn't matter if its a sword or a staff or whatever.
a. You fire off a shot at range, better hope they dont move because if they do you'll miss because the projectiles are so slow. 
b. One weapon that is fun to use, the blunderbuss, it's effective and useful. 
c. Staves are barely useful, life staff is ok at healing but that's it. Fire mage archetype doesn't feel like a glass cannon, more like a glass peashooter that sounds really cool, for example.
e. Use the musket to shoot a deer in the head? You better be prepared to do it 20 more times since the damage is so low.

- Pointless 10% XP buff for leveling while flagged for PVP. Just means you'll be ganked by players 30 levels higher than you, nothing competitive or interesting. Purely a open world PVP issue but toxic and brings a deja vu feeling from many other failed games.

- Artifact weapons locked behind 100s of hours of PVP, the only artifact healing staff is locked behind PVP AND the RNG devil.

Game is great. people bitching about queues dont understand how MMOs work... the first week of launch can not be planned for... people dont understand that server cap right now is 2000 people. that being said NA EAST had 55 servers the day of launch. okay so lets do some basic math here 2000*55=110000 TOTAL PEOPLE to be able to log in and play. in the last 28 hours NA EAST has expanded by approx 42 servers adding another 84000 slots. this game has approx 250k-350k people attempting to log in these people are complaining that we have queue times.. which is understandable. but you know what we havent had. servers constantly crashing and game breaking bugs... just a bunch of small shit. also amazon is currently looking to expand to 5k-10k server cap. they are also allowing people to migrate to other servers for free so they can avoid the queues. NO MMO  launch in the last 10 years has been this smooth. also here is some more insight into MMO launches. https://www.gamesradar.com/its-just-impossible-devs-explain-why-big-online-games-always-seem-to-break-at-launch

Oh New World, I started playing this game on release actually. Together with my boyfriend, and 1000s of other players! Running around, hunting wolves, choosing your weapons, etc. The start was wonky to say the least.. we still made friends and had fun, but it didn't feel quite finished. The long ass waiting lines to get into the servers, the bugfest, and so much more. That's why my boyfriend and I left the game alone for about a year.

When we returned though, ho-ho-ho, we returned. Now having 200 hours into it, I can really say that NOW it is worth your money! It is genuinely a fun game with an interesting community. So many things that you can do;
=> PvP related things
=> Some solo gathering
=> Run around with your friends
=> Quests
=> Your own pet wolf with the DLC

And honestly a lot more. Definitely recommend! <3_<3

[b]✓︎ Inventory:[/b]

My first experience with New World wasn't great. Played at launch, had ridiculous queue times and the game seemed sort of half baked. Now I've given it a second chance with Angry Earth out and the game seems to be in a good place. Compared to other MMO's this world seems more alive. I enjoy the smaller map as most MMO's are just full of large empty spaces. There's generally people running around, especially in towns, and the chat seems quite alive. 

Gameplay is fun and a nice change of pace from the usual tab target MMO stuff. Life skills are great and fun to use in an almost Runescape like way. Combat is quick and doesn't feature 20 buttons to press for skills which to me is a nice change of pace. It's a pretty if not demanding game, so not sure how optimized it would be on lower settings. 

Definitely worth checking out, and I do recommend you get Angry Earth as well. Wait for a sale if you're hesitant but Angry Earth will give you a mount at level 25 and it's rather handy.

It's a standard MMO; quest, gather, craft, and level-up. The graphics and sound are quite good and combat has some good features. But, the faction part of the game can become unbalanced so a server with a medium population is required. Servers can lag and the server management is so-so. 

The game is good (PVE) till level 60 (it doesn't take long) then it becomes an insipid gear & craft grind. Past 60 you'll find players running ecr's where a mob of players rush through elite zones easily killing all the bosses; it's a silly loot binge. When playing solo you'll have to endure being mobbed by NPC. There's PVP as an end game but it's dreadful. The ability to connect with other players is poor & companies are basically useless. Expedition runs lack participation. The game is unbalanced (weapons/armor) & it lacks focus (crafting). The lore is boring. There are too many key features that need improvement or revision.

After three playthroughs (I gave it a chance) it's a 2/10. Ignore the developer's glossy & very misleading advertising trailers, this is a mediocre game & too many poor development decisions caused player numbers to plummet. The business model relies on cash grabs via a season pass & questionable DLC's. My harshest criticism; all those associated with the development of this game should reconsider their career choice. I would avoid AGS games until they change their awful approach to game development.
combat is great with build diversity and fun weapon combos. it keeps getting better each season.

A Visually Striking World That Fails to Spark Excitement

New World, with its promising premise and visually stunning landscapes, falls short of delivering a truly captivating gaming experience. While the graphics are impressive, the overall gameplay feels dull and uninspired, leaving players yearning for more substance.

The Good:

Visual Splendor: Undoubtedly, New World boasts breathtaking visuals. The game's environments are beautifully crafted, with detailed landscapes, dynamic weather effects, and realistic character models. It succeeds in creating an aesthetically pleasing world that draws players in.

Solid Combat Mechanics: The combat system in New World is decent, offering a mix of ranged and melee engagements. The variety of weapons and the real-time action contribute to engaging encounters, adding a layer of excitement to the gameplay.

The Not-So-Good:

Lackluster Quest Design: Despite the visually stunning backdrop, the quests in New World often feel uninspired and repetitive. The narrative lacks depth, and players might find themselves going through the motions without a strong sense of purpose or motivation.

Monotonous Progression: The game's progression system feels monotonous, with a lack of innovation in character development and skill acquisition. The grind becomes more of a chore than an enjoyable journey, and the excitement of leveling up diminishes quickly.

Limited Endgame Content: New World struggles to provide compelling endgame content. Once players reach the higher levels, the lack of meaningful activities or challenges may lead to a sense of emptiness and a lack of long-term motivation.

Uninspired Crafting System: While crafting is a significant aspect of the game, the system lacks the depth and complexity found in other MMOs. Crafting feels more like a checklist than a strategic and engaging aspect of gameplay.

Conclusion:

New World succeeds in creating a visually impressive world, but the lack of innovation in quest design, progression mechanics, and endgame content results in a game that falls short of its potential. While there are moments of excitement in combat, the overall experience feels dull and lacks the spark needed to keep players invested for the long haul. As it stands, New World is a beautiful but somewhat hollow gaming experience, leaving players craving more substance and innovation.

New World is an in-depth MMO with full immersion into a world all unto itself. You can quest, you can harvest, you can trade, you can choose what you want to do and there is a large variety of ways you can build your character. You can do whatever you want. And now with mounts!

The game is great. It's much different than at launch. Sure, it's a lot of a grind but it is an MMO. What did you expect? 

I took my leveling experience as a way to gatekeep maps. Once I maxed out and hit 65, the world was opened to me. Was it easier? Sure, some areas became jokes but theres still the tradeskills to level. The areas and some quests are useful for unlocking things and gathering materials. 

Lets not forget about  the weapon skills too. Sure, they only go to level 20, but a lot of them are fun. Who cares if its meta if your doing PvE. Find a company or a group of friends you can do stuff with, Its not hard. 

From my experience, every weapon is viable in the hands of a skilled user. I've seen weird builds work really well. It comes down to your perks and people don't get that. 

For PvP, things scale differently sometimes. I like PvPing, I use a musket trap build with an ice gauntlet. It works. Sure, its not meta or anything but its fun and I like it. 

If you're going to take anything away from this review, take this;

Game is fun at first, gives you the classic old-style exploration I enjoyed in my earlier days gaming.

Graphics are okay, optimization is less than stellar. If you have the recommended settings, you can run 60 fps maybe 70% of the time. There's random lag spikes that occur, but without any trend I could figure out. Doesn't seem more or less common despite whether or not I'm in a populated area, in combat, in a new zone, or even consistent timing between spikes.

Once you get to the mid-levels you start to notice the classic gatekeeping paywalls of modern day gaming. Pay $40 for the game and only get 1/4 of the content. Mounts, max level, new areas, classes... Amazon demands a sacrifice first. 

End-game may as well not exist unless you feed amazon their money, and then you start to realize that there isn't much fun in the game regardless, unless you absolutely love New World's style of PvP. 

There's nothing too special here worth the time or money. If you're going to buy it, at least get it if it ever goes on sale.

I never thought i'd be that type of person to push the "this game is dying" mantra but Numbers don't lie, towns feel mostly empty even at peak times, a shadow of a former life  - For reference: https://steamcharts.com/app/1063730#6m

New world has some nice things going for it, but with little in the way of new pvp content & pve endgame content (not including new dungeons) going on 3 years after launch its now VERY repetitive.

Wars are bland & not really wars.. 50 players is a skirmish not a war & you'll often find even if you sign up you wont get chosen regardless of experience, mostly top players in certain clans 

Open world mass pvp very underwhelming with player caps in effect (if vicinity cap is exceeded players are teleported away)

Outpost rush still no new map only 1.

Feels like PVP has been abandoned, which is odd being that the games premise is about clans vying for control over contested territory. 

With this info in mind i'd strongly reevaluate whether this game is worth your money & time investment, if pvp is your jam don't bother you'll just end up writing a negative review & becoming irritated with the dev, pve on the other hand is somewhat enjoyable but there isn't much in the way of Endgame activities, all content after level 65 just bottoms out.

Definitely one of the most enjoyable MMOs I have played. I loved the profession system, but I cannot recommend this game to anyone new. The leveling experience is quite enjoyable, and the skill system is easy to understand and feels freeing. Half of your time spent in the world is going to be spent walking from objective to objective unless you want to spend another 30 euro to get the expansion that lets you ride mounts.

The player count has fallen immensely, and I frankly don't see the game surviving many more years, so I can't get myself to invest any more time into it. It's sad, but it happens.

If you do not however care about the falling player count, long walks, and in case you are in the EU, chats full of everything but English, I can recommend it.

This is the first game I have ever bought in my life that has a lot of lag spikes. Not once did I ever have any problems with Elder Scrolls Online. Not once. I hate to downvote New World, but I have to. I don't mind lag spikes if it's a free game, but to pay 70 euros for this game and not be able to play it properly, is a rip off. It's 40 euros for the game and an extra 30 for the dlc - the dlc only includes another tiny quest area and a basic mount with some challenges for the horse. Also, it's an extra 20 to 25 euros to buy a more cooler looking mount, it's about 20 to 25 euros to pay for a costume - and they're awful looking. The store shop is very expensive and if there were no problems or lags with the game I wouldn't mind so much. The gameplay itself and the classes are great and the graphics look amazing I have to say. The mobs are a lot more intelligent too and can dodge better than other mobs in other online games. Dungeons look pretty good but they're not popular. The hair colour shades just don't match at all. White hair looks grey a lot of the time. Light Blonde hair looks a sort of very light green. The bad character customization I can put up with, but the lag spikes is something else for a game that cost me 70 euros. As I said, I've bought loads of games via steam and all that, and this is the very first game I paid for, that has lag spikes. Well I've wasted 70 euros so I just hope they'll fix those spikes. If you don't mind lag spikes and being in a dungeon party where you get lag spikes and it makes you get stuck or gets your character killed, then fine, you might enjoy the game.

I'm updating my review because I recently returned to the game after a while away.  Though the early experience is fine and often very enjoyable, once you hit level 50 the game essentially becomes unbearable--a literal chore to play. Leveling up crafting skills takes an inordinate amount of time, and despite recent revisions to the loot table I kept getting stuff of wildly different levels--some quite good, others completely worthless. It's just a grind now and I'm over it. I've permanently deleted it because I have no intention of ever coming back.

it Seems every year the game inches closer and closer with aim assist increases. shots I take that I would have missed now miraculously hit. slashes I swing that would have made me look like an idiot now are devastating to the enemy. I bought this game because it wasn't supposed to be runescape or world of warcraft but now combat feels like its catered to those that complain about their poor coordination. 

the latest DLC is a farce. they took a spot of land that came with the game. blocked off access and are now selling it back. with 3 new enemy variants that have somewhat new animations, the gorilla, the elephant and the chameleon. the rest are copy paste reskins with vaguely new animations. even the newest frost boss is lazerous now on a spinny chair acting like he is the drummer for led zeppelin without the rhythm.

the mounts are the biggest sales pitch for the game in the sense that they at least make the most intensely mind numbing missions pass by a bit faster. they dont bother to fix their side missions or faction missions any bit more fun but now you can do them 1.5x to 1.75x faster.

every event is plagued with a train of players that hit the world bosses and zap its health down in less than 5 seconds which makes not having the DLC near impossible to fight and get rewards for unless you camp the spawn point and you might be able to participate one every hour or so. even then, if you dont have the DLC, your competing with level 65s that deal way more damage than you, so good luck if you want to get any reward if and when you do get to fight the boss.

The current DLC will be worth it by the time they are ready to sell the next DLC and have installed enough updates to make enough additional content to justify its price most likely but even then, at the end of the day, your a pirate or privateer with no boat that cant swim. your an ice mage that cant freeze water to make an ice bridge. your a warrior with a warhammer that cant bust down walls, your an archer that cant light a building on fire. your a swordsmen that cant deface the enemy banners and no, you are never a rogue. that is not in the game. you are either high enough level that the hostile wild life wont attack unless you kiss their nose or they wont want anything to do with you or your low enough that everything looks at you like a cat toy.

I enjoyed the game when it came out. Logging, mining, exploring, sneaking around other players was quite fun. Combat was interesting and varied but there were quite a few bugs that could exploited. But once gathering and crafting got tedious, the game lost most of its charm. I stopped playing for a year or so and came back to see a premium currency to go along with a paid expansion to get mounts and an in-game store. For a $55 game. Fine, lots of games do the in-game store for premium skins. Well this also includes transmogs of existing skins. If I want to change up the skin of the item I'm wearing, I have to buy marks. The smallest quantity I can buy is 5,000 marks. for 6.99. It takes 2,500 to unlock the skin of one item. Not a premium skin, any style you find in game. You can only unlock these skins by buying them, or the Free Season Pass Rewards Track. 1 Transmog Token can be earned at Level 15, Level 50, and Level 100 for a total of 3 Transmog Tokens. That seems crazy low considering how many armour and weapon skins are in the game. I like to change up my style often but I'm not going to pay to do so. I would hate if I unlocked a skin but it had clipping issues with other skins. These tokens need to be earn-able in game. There's also STILL no way to change your hair in the game. But guaranteed if they do, you'll have to pay real money for it. 

End game isn't here. There's not much to do and PVP is extremely unbalanced. I don't do PVP much but I got more than wrecked on multiple occasions because of the weapons I use. I use them because I have fun with them but in PVP I stood absolutely no chance because they aren't the meta and if you don't use the boring meta template then you're going to lose. PVE I was crushing everything around me but PVP I might as well lay down and accept death.

We finally got mounts, but also behind a $41 "DLC". So now something that should have been in the game, the devs said definitely won't be in the game, is in the game and we have to pay to use it. And you gain an advantage if you do so. 

Another game that has the potential to be good but is ruined by monetary greed of Amazon Games.

Positive experience simply isn't here. Economy is terrible, PvP's one singular repeatable map is stale. Incredibly difficult to get situated and feel any amount of meaningful progress. About 40 hours logged last week, spent all of my 28k on two items, hotswapped sets because you have to weirdly minmax everything you do including *opening boxes*, new items weren't on preset so just destroyed my entire savings after a mass decon because trying to track their abysmal systems and UI is laborious under even the best circumstances. Almost everything is glitched or bugged, mobs are infuriating....game had a lot of potential that absolutely has not been followed through on in any meaningful way. They seemingly do not have the devs or resources to actually improve things at a reasonable pace (or at all). There's something here buried under the trash, for sure - but it will never be allowed to shine, and one should not buy in with the expectation that it ever will. Cannot and do not recommend to anyone, for any reason.

exploration =w= and a bunch of vomiting zombies. now has pay to progress in lvl and so on, so add 35 dollars to whatever

The game is fun, combat is great if you like souls game or otherwise non spammy systems.  customer support actually has a live chat,  unfortunately im 1/5 getting one that was actually not rude.

so 375 hours later, the fun has been sucked from this game.  Every activity is a chore. crafting takes literally hundreds of hours of boring work and i still cant make anything useful.  unless you have a clan that feeds you or are ok with 500+ hours to craft them don't bother.  you have to craft keys to run the dungeons and people are paying to get into teams, and you pay a lot. pvp has gotten rough due to desync issues and i pretty much don't play anymore and neither does my company.  I wanted this to be "THE" game for me but its just a grind with no reward.
At face value a new player will enjoy new world... that is until you peel back the proverbial onion and smell its rotten core.  the combat is awesome and both pvp and pve are pretty good minus desync in pvp.  this game offers a lot for people who like to grind , craft and casually fight stuff.  

the reason for the negative review is from the start the game only really rewarded the guilds that owned 2 of the cities,  while the rest of the cities cost money to maintain these 2 cities made millions a week. this caused a huge imbalance in haves and have-nots in pvp, and the auction house was ruined by the people in said guilds because money is no factor when every 2 hours you make as much as a player does in a month of  grinding. 

the worst part and nail in the coffin , they used to gate keep end game pve and players not in the super elite guilds had to be extorted for a slot in a raid they HAVE a key for.  

Finally and maybe my least favorite thing about this game is the way to increase your gear score and collect decent loot.... you join zergs of people many times randoms who then run in a giant loop opening chests and killing a boss here or there with 10x the ppl needed to do so, these groups are impersonal and leave you behind so if you have to pee good luck  its an all out endurance race to loot pixels while putting forth the least amount of effort possible.  
tldr: the end game is hot garbage and the disparity between regular players and the rich elite is too far to bridge.
Yes it is the worst game i have ever played, i finally un installed and feel a sense of relief :)

Game is ok, still a lot of bugs to work on.

Ill go back to WoW and other MMOs that atleast have some sort of development process behind them

EDIT: 
Its actually a great game now. They fixed nearly everything I disliked:
- Good Items from PvP
- no shard grind anymore, instead of M1-10 its M1-3 now
- no expertise anymore
- new push mechanics to declare war. Pushes are fun now
- cross Server OPR is very nice, instant qeue pop. WoW BGs take like 15 mins and you dont find any BGs at night. In new world you can play OPR (BGs) all night.
- The expansion is very nice, I love the themes. Chest runs are fast now.
- Gear Sets are finally in the game. They cost real money tho so keep that in mind.
- not a bug fest anymore
- good economy
- crafting isnt shit anymore
- you can change perks on named items, so its way easier to get BiS now

When I got into this game I really wanted it to be my new MMO pastime. After having had a not so bad experience from Lost Ark I came in with an open mind. I kinda of wish I could give it a mixed review but since I have to choose it'll be a no.

- The game graphics are honestly subpar to whats being done these days, some might argue its a design style, personally I don't so
- Enemies are pretty boring, with a lack of attacks, animation.
- You will most see the same enemies over and over again.
- The combat is the most bland stuff I've ever seen in an MMORPG, cast fireballs for hours with 3 spells, 6 if you count the fact you have two weapons. This could work in some PVP game with something more dynamic but here it's just slow and annoying I feel like.
- The quest lines are confusing, I somehow got myself in an area that was 45-50 following the main quest line and doing the side quests at level 41.
- Expeditions, which are I'm assuming dungeons, are literally empty it took me hours to find a group and get in finally.
- Going from place A to place B is super slow, even with a mount, fast travel helps but it doesnt work with stuff you haven't seen yet, which I can somewhat understand.

Honestly disappointed. Good game with horrible implementations and developers. I love testing new builds in all RPG games I play. But this game blocks the player from doing this by literally not allowing you to farm a certain item for WEEKS until a certain dungeon is up again. Not to mention the ludicrous amount of money you need to purchase/upgrade gear to have a competent PvP build. Crafting is a fucking nightmare. To craft weapons and armor you need an item that costs and arm and a leg, that can only be bought ONCE PER DAY!

I get that this is an MMO, but holy shit! All of these mechanics are meant to get the player to come back constantly and slowly progress to getting their upgrades. But for people who just want to enjoy the game modes and not grind for a whole fucking month, it sucks ass.

There are bugs AGS refuses/can't fix for some reason. A "minor" one that's really annoying is the Magnify bug. It gets rid of a part of your stats until you repair or unequip and re-equip.

The one thing that makes me come back is the combat. The combat feels really good! But I mostly hate everything else. For that reason, I think I'm done. Time for an uninstall.
I got my $40 worth
Def could be better in some ways but... what game can't? Beautiful landscapes, cool character customization, and nice fighting. Worth the money.

While I did enjoy New World for a time, there are still many problems which plague the game: 

-Lack of weapon variety, especially magic weapons. 
-Bot farmers everywhere. 
-PVP is always a lag-fest infested with bugs and exploiters. 
-Towns still lag out down to 10FPS. 
-Mounts are locked behind a paywall, yet offer nothing more than a speed-boost. 
-Running animation is janky and does not match terrain map or material. 

There's many more. But for just these reasons I cannot recommend New World.
great game so far

It's very hamster wheel, it feels vast and like there's a lot to do. In reality you often end up running around endlessly farming different material. They've designed a daft crafting system, which continiously relies upon lower tier things. So say you want to craft an item at say tier 4, you'll need to get around 3-400 of the tier 1 item, which is needed to make the tier 2 which you need for tier 3 etc etc. It's a rat maze for the most part, the weapon abilities are lacking, you don't have many options for each weapon. The game is built around auctions, so you can't sell junk items to shops, you either store it or destroy it.

Updated:Roughly 1000 hrs in man i really want to love this game but they make it so hard. Updates just take way to long, fixes just take way to long. The small server sizes cause servers to die quicker which causes mergers to occur faster. Even if you ignore those things the coding and engine this game runs on is just plagued with issues that they just can't fix and it will always have them; perfect example is the duping it was something that happen on release and is still and issue now it just happened recently and the TP had to be taken down. Cheaters, RMTing is not monitored at all in this game and gold is extremely important in this game due to crafting being the end game of gear for the majority of content so it makes the issue much worse. I know everyone loves to say oh the devs don't stop the bots so i have no choice but to RMT this is the same thing said over and over about bots. Guess what if you BAN players who RMT guess what happens; word gets around and people become afraid to buy gold which in turn kills the botters because they will have nobody to sell to. Not to mention the Meta has been Light Dex for months now and they have yet to do anything even though there have been thousands of complaints its actually a joke at this point.

Update: 2k Hours in and unfortunately i have a soft spot for this game but i really can't recommend it to anyone it would be wrong of me to do so. Positives they have made the leveling experience much better but still lacking they have put time into the MSQ but really nobody cares about it and that's not an opinion that's just most players because the MSQ is kind of all over the place and doesn't really have characters you will stick with except Isabella. Combat still the main point of this game its definitely not balanced but it is enjoyable and you can express skill but there are weapons that just simply outshine others at the moment so if you looking for a game like that don't expect it and they are ungodly slow to make any changes. They don't have dedicated pvp dev so the PVP is completely ignored and there has been no new PVP casual map in over 2 years if that proves my point even tho players have been begging and yelling at the top of there lungs. PVE is still extremely lack luster 1 Raid which honestly is debatable it should even be called a raid and nobody does it and its outdated already. The dungeons are very rudimentary they are nice aesthetically but the honeymoon phase of that ends extremely quickly once you have done the same dungeons multiple times. The War/Territory system in the game has been ignored which is the end game pvp and again players have been yelling to have changes and nothing lets put it this way its the end game pvp but only about 5-10% of the player population can join them and not because they are not fun but because they are player gated completely. So if you looking for a game to put thousands of hours into like myself i will save you the trouble i've done it for you and there is that copium that the devs will stop having smooth brains. If you are looking for a game to maybe get 200-300 hours out of it sure it will be fine you won't run into the issues weather it be balancing/tech/content that the long term players have run into but play this game more like a dark souls and move on after you achieved what you wanted. I will warn new players if you like doing dungeons at lower levels good luck this game is very lacking on new players most the player base have been longer term players. Unfortunately due to the many things i mentioned earlier this game has a serious issue retaining new players or just bringing them in. If you look at there own discord it is covered in negativity and if you look at reddit it is even worse. So yea TLDR short term game not for people who want a long term mmo its a buy play move on don't turn back sorta of game. The player numbers indicate that.

The game is focused on pvp, but its nice to play pve too. Ppl complain that there  are no end game content, but I don't care. I play for fun, and hate games with eternal new content like wow. I just like to play, make a full build to enjoy pvp for fun with few time per day to play.

Lag detected so i cant play, been like that since they started server merging a long time ago and repeatedly i redownload to try and see if it will work. It doesnt, spend your money elsewhere.

Nearly a year later, downloaded the game and it crashed my system opening it. Finally got it working and somehow its still poorly optimized and lag spikes everywhere, same experience would be running up stairs with a strobe light.
After the Brimstone Sands Update and the Rise of the Angry Earth Expansion, New World is where it should have been from the Start. If you havent played it yet, now is the perfect time for it.
great game i love it, developers seems to really care about this game,

Hello all, well this is my review of the game:
Pros
Graphics are great, very visually orientated

Cons:
I had the game for 3 days, had a blast then it just stopped playing. I will no longer launch. I have done every thing online and still cannot play anymore.
Customer service is unfortunately not helpful. They request information, and then do nothing to assist. I was suppose to get a response within 24 to 48 hours after 3 days I got nothing. They are aware of the issue but have failed to resolve the ability to launch the game.
So would I recommend to another, not at this point in time. There is no support, and with the price you pay it is frustrating to buy something and not be able to use it. Sorry all it would be a great game if they would ensure that it would launch, so that people could play.

I took my time and recently hit max level (at time of this writing = 65).  If you like MMORPG's this is a really good one.  It'snot without its flaws but what game isn't?  Very easy to jump right in and start.  One of those games easy to play, hard to master.  

There are lots of things one can do - you can solo in living world and do 'solo' things and be quite happy, just as well as dungeon crawling, and a healthy dose of PVP.  I'm just learning the dungeons/PVP and they're a lot of fun.  For the price and zero subscription fees, this is a great game if you like RPG type games.

Jan 2024 Update: I recommend you do not buy it.  I still update the game today, Because I invested 5,000 hours across 7 accounts and several deluxe editions.  I have a heavy sink cost associated with my action.

It easy to get started. Almost all games are that way. Then the developer makes you feel like a fish on a hook.  It is is much easier today, than it was to gain level when it was first launched.  It is much more polished today than when it first launched. 

After the first year, I stopped.  I had not involved myself with any of its war for several years.  A new player may find it interesting, as it is part of the selling point.  I myself find no values in it based on my own experience.  

What I do is loiter avoid making any time investment.  Which will be destroyed by the game developer with future changes.  This sentiment had been consistent across many years.  

Crafting system: I stopped investing time into it

Economy system: Pretty stupid how it is in its current state, with clunky interface and functionality.  A horrible way to suffer.

Game play:  Pretty fun in the aspect that you can enjoy some exploration with a group of people. 

pvp: stupid pretty pointless for me.  I had that perpetually turned off as well as never participate in any of the war.  Other still do, but I find the rewards lacking in meaning.  It seems to cater to people who has a desire to play bully, and New World provide like a softcore platform for bully to exercise their desires.  

PVE: OK-Good.  The pve part of this game, is very much run in a large circle.  How it accomplish this is, it offers awards for opening chests. Which are hidden around the map, guarded by monsters and boss.  Everyday, you will have different people organize a group run.  20 people or so just run in a large circle and open chest. 4 hours a day was what I was spending on running in circle looting chests.  Pretty low value game in my opinion.

Skins sales: Outside of making you pay for the game. They offer you ingame purchases.  I initially buy skins and stuff to enjoy the game more, and support the developer.  I had long since stopped.  They do not offer real advantages, but more cosmetics quality of life items.  I hate the art style, but the young kids seem to find it nice.  (I think 14years old is the target audience).  I am 45 so it is understandable.  I cannot support their focus on money.  They design the game and design the updates around making you  pay for these.  So in a way I felt cheated.  Like that time I paid for a tour if Korea, but it was basically 2 weeks of taking me to places to buy stuff, and putting with salesman.

The game maker: Before I bought the game, I understood Amazon to have the fund to do what it wants, and as long as you have never ending money--you cant lose.  My assessment after playing and having to deal with Amazon is as folllow.  Amazon is not your friend.  They look for every means to squeeze more money out of you.  The game is the bait and hook.  There's some balancing to monetizing peole's depravity like casino.  14 years old wouldnt understand how that is a bad thing.  Online game is not regulated by gambling commision so it has a free hand at getting children hooked on gambling.  If you understand the slot machines at the casino, then you can understand how the chest looting is very much a more fancy slot machine.  If you walk around las vegas, you can see how slot machines take up the most space.  It is simple, and effective at holding peolple's addiction.

As long as Amazon is behind a game: avoid it.  I had pre ordered Lost Ark, but simply did not play it after my experiences with Amazon.  100% of my time invested in my virtual life, is pretty much reset to zero.  Imagine working all your life, and have all your money, home, car, and asset erased after 20 years of working hard to build up your wealth and position in society.  Then have it done again.  and again.

The fact that the only options for queued PvP play are 3 v 3 or OPR and that they do not have a persistent zone, astounds me. Such immense loss of potential. PvP should be meaningful!!! 

The skills are sub-standard even when compared to MMORPGS of 10 plus years ago. The graphics are nice, the worlds okay. But in all this game disappointing on most major aspects.

The economy is a disaster. The PvE content is somewhat decent. it is something to play at best....

It's truly disheartening; this MMO has one of the best foundations for creating something great, boasting excellent combat and fantastic ideas. However, what do they do? They release it with poor content, and instead of swiftly adding positive elements, they launch a PAID (and expensive) DLC to fix something that should have already been in the base game.

This is treating the player like an idiot, a blatant disrespect to those who purchased it at launch expecting improvements. People believed that all those maps with repetitive and generic mobs were simply due to a rushed release.

Rather than investing to earn the players' respect, as No Man's Sky and games with lackluster launches did, they choose to bury the game.

It's a shame.

This is a tough one. I'm going to stay away from the DLC until the end. The game is beautiful. Mechs works well and are just the right amount of challenging. The crafting and gathering system is amazing and competitive plus the storage system is kinda cool and keeps you busy. 
My biggest issue is the spawn rate of mobs. At first it is great because respawn is fast. Then at higher levels it is just as fast, which creates issues when you just cleared an area around a boss and all the cleared mobs pop back up mid-fight. This turns a challenging game into several frustrating deaths and spending an hour trying to work around it. There is one instance of this during an MSQ that made me want to walk away from the game entirely. lvl 36 quest being done at lvl 46 and still far too difficult for casual players. I went from happy and excited about the game to angry and frustrated and resentful of the game in a matter of minutes. I have run into a few cases of this but this one MSQ has changed my outlook on the game. Even after finally getting past it and sleeping on my thoughts I still cannot get past how poorly done this one part it and how easy it would be to fix it. Because of this and the limits not getting the DLC puts on you if you do not want to shell out $30 for a mount, it is a no for me. 2 chars, one 60, current 48, 260 hours, still going to play but well not recommend. I have no plans on getting the DLC, not at $30.

A decent game, but ruined by some basic MMO fails.

1. Basic parts of the game are locked behind group content that no one does, which leaves new players forever at a disadvantage to older players. (e.g. Artefacts that require group bosses or elite zones, heartrunes that require expeditions and no one does these and there is no group finder for this content) and to build a character strong enough to do some of this content solo requires specific artefacts which are locked behind the content you are trying to do and you aren't even able to do lower level expeditions solo because they require a minimum of 3 players.

2. Premades dominate PvP and devs refuse to fix this in fear of premade players leaving the game if they aren't free to dominate solo queuing players. Only one version of the main PvP mode which is so bad that for new players the best way to progress is to do PvE in the PvP map.

3. No group finder for group content and no one does this content anyway. The final part of the main story quest is in an expedition that no one does. So new players can't experience these which out significant time finding a group.

4. Constant inventory management that requires grinding rep to be able to buy a house to increase your bank size. You can't trade items between other characters on your account, so each character will need to grind out rep.

5. Poor quality transmog system designed to extract money from players. To unlock the transmog appearance for a single armour piece or weapon requires a transmog token which is expensive. Very few free transmog items. Dyes are single use only (and available in the cash shop).

6. Story is decent with some appropriately tough parts where you need to work out how to defeat a boss. Later story content after the original main story is better, and all parts can be done solo so they have fixed the problem with the main story requiring an expedition no one does. 

7. Character creation and design is basic, not a lot of options and very behind some of the modern MMOs. 

8. The world is interesting, although there is a derth of enemy designs. All enemies seem to be either wolves, undead (4 or 5 different versions), plant creatures, corrupted (like undead but red) and a few other animals like scorpions or bears. As you progress you are still seeing the same small number of enemy types, even up to the most recent content.

9. Performance is decent on my system, although "lag detected" is a common annoyance.
Honestly, it's fun to a point, but the pve is honestly garbage, the questing is super boring daily quests the mmo, and though the pvp is fun, it's still a higher GS wins more often than not.

Some similar/repetitive quests get old quick yet as an overall play through is quite interesting and engaging. Soundtrack is superb, graphically it is one of a best looking MMOs-yet not without tweaks, game has rather blurry textures on default even ,if running on the highest settings, lack of anti-aliasing and weird shimmer/flicker which may have something to do with poor anti-aliasing implementation. It is time for devs to bring this up to directx 12 and implement features like DLSS and frame generation which should take care of cleaning up the image. Despite the stated issues, they aren't really game breaking, overal graphics fidelity is nice. This is one of the games one can return to routinely.

I played new world for a fair bit... only got to lvl 62 I believe. Honestly, the initial leveling was pretty cool and fun. I had fun with the gathering aspect of it and working on trade skills. Unfortunately for me, as I continued to progress and see how the kind of day to do activities worked, it didn't seem all too bright. For instance, upon leveling to max level, you'll find out that the higher level dungeons (or mutations as this game puts it) is meaningless really... you just play for the sake of playing it because the gear (which is the next problem for me) can easily be bought on the auction house. You can just buy the best gear right off the AH. There's no sense of progression and is definitely the reason why a lot of players don't do the higher dungeons in the game which is a big aspect of any part of a PvE. Also, it became kind of pointless to level your trade skills up to craft your awesome end game gear because again, AH has everything you need.
     The PvP is pretty decent except for how everybody "plays" the pvp. As a lot of players have stated, the meta is for everyone to run around in heavy gear rolling around the ground... it's pretty damn funny. I try to envision the American Revolution with the red coats and patriots storming a battle field and they're all just rolling constantly on the floor avoiding musket fire. Anyway, it's a game I realize but the PvP is limited to one battleground that you can "que" for or you can join pre-made open world pvp groups, which is kind of limited to people who invest a lot of time in the game and have a social circle setup in the game. So you have to, as I've been told by other players, build a name for yourself with clans and other group organizers so you can join the open PvP sessions. I dunno, not my thing... I like to just jump on when I can and play right when I can and not be limited to my social status on the game. With that said, it is an MMO and it works for certain players and that's great. Not a great fit for me right now and the PvE seems to kind of be pointless with purchasing the best end game gear on the AH ( you basically beat the game at that point, no reason to complete other content or farm for anything unless you just like to play the game for the sake of just enjoying and playing the game, which works too).

Oh and one more criticism of the game I'd like to add, you have to buy transmog tokens with real money. I think there are certain events "sometimes" you can earn these... other than that, you're really just limited to having to spend real money so you can transmog your gear...definitely a penny pincher idea for the game to do this to the players.

 Overall this game is not Bad, it however is far from Great and AGS does not seem willing to make the Correct calls or to put in content at a faster pace,(that does not Break some part of the game) And provide more in-game late game content for every one to enjoy.
If there was more to do across the board aside for Arenas, OPR, Wars, Invasions and Expeditions (Aka Dungeons) and territory Races for your CHANCE to declare war. First and foremost I agree with the previous poster who said some of these negative reviews are disingenuous. 600+ hours and max level and you give this game a thumbs down, bro this game was obviously worth your time and money. Don't pour your entire life into a game and then trash it when you get bored of it. I have about 60 hours logged so far and I'm mid-level so I will give a beginners take. I haven't played an MMO since WoW and was looking for that MMO nostalgia in a newer game. This game really surprised me. It looks absolutely stunning. The combat system in my opinion is a little different but pretty fluid there is no auto targeting and knowing when to dodge or block an attack is essential. You really have to practice your keyboard/mouse manipulation but its pretty simple once you get a hang of the strike zones. If you're the type of player that likes crafting and collecting ingredients/materials this is the game for you. It's a little overwhelming at first the amount of stuff you can make and you can literally pick, chop, cut anything you come across in the wild. its a little overwhelming at first but after a day or so the system starts making sense. There's a bunch of other non-crafting skills you can improve, you can pick up an instrument and jam out similar to guitar-hero. But If you suck it definitely shows and people can hear when you screw up the notes so practice alone first LOL. 

As much as i like the game I have to say it feels empty sometimes. They really need to revamp the group system. If you want to raid or do dungeons you essentially wait in a lobby or create a lobby and wait for players to join. They really need to come up with a matchmaking system because it seems nigh impossible to ever find people to group with. But sadly i think a large contributor is that this game simply lacks the popularity of the big-name MMO's which is a shame because in my opinion they got so many things right with this game. I think with more content and tweaks this game could really be a huge competitor. Definitely worth the money.

All right, it's time after almost 900 hours in the game to write a review. This game was very enjoyable at first, I'm not gonna lie and I had great time with friends in the early days. The more I played, the more flaws this game was showing so here's the rent. 

Game wants to be an OpenWorld PVP,  but there's no point of running around in PVP. Usually players that are 'PVP On' don't want to fight, they instantly run away or trash talk you for killing them.

From what I understood, it's mostly the same companies that have all the territories but just on different account, because amazon games let them do so.

The game is filled with bugs, by experience, it took them 3 weeks to repair a Main Story Quest bug that was preventing people from doing the actual MSQ. Most companies would have got it fixed the same day, but not for AGS.

The endgame is poor, and has a lack entertainment. 
There's a ton of bots, but grats they are there to sell me the mats, because I had no intention on going around to collect the materiel to craft. 
There's no bank system, so if you got more than 500k on you and sell something, well you lose that money ! :D 

I uninstalled the game today, after a announcement of a new patch, there was no work made on the endgame.
Managers don't listen to their community. People have been asking for three years for a new map to do the OutpostRush. But they keep putting their attention on New Players and creating contents for them, which they didnt ask. 
Don't rent about anything in there discord channel, you might get banned. 

I invested a lot of time in this MMORPG, but I now feel like I'm wasting my time, I see no future for this game. So i got to go..

****First Review****
Good Game so far, Needs more servers to lower que times but over all really fun game 5 hours in one sitting. 6 hours on record when i first wrote this, hundred plus hours later still a really good game. Que times are fixed and the server merge helped payer populations! This is a really good MMO! I will say it does need something low level players can que for like a 3v3 thing for levels 10-19 20-29 -30-39 and so on! but its still a baby MMO and can not wait to see whats to come!
****Update*****
Que times are fixed. 3v3 added, Content for lower levels being added in as we speak! Cant wait to see what more is to come!
***Update****
620 hours into playing and I'm still not slowing down! All the problems I had in my first review have been solved. New stuff gets added almost every month! Constantly changing MMO no in game way to P2W, no monthly subscription, no character boosts, no Tab targeting. Basically if you enjoy a MMO where your journey starts are level 1 and not just end game this is the game! A lot to do at end game but everything you do/collect through level 1-59 matters like crafting mods, resource, and much more! Player housing is some of the best housing I have seen in a MMO including FF14/OSRS/WoW(Garrisons). I could go on and on about the good about this 40$(20-30$ on sale) game but some of the bad is no Raiding yet, so if you like BIG PVE Boss content that is not in the game yet, but as I said they are constantly updating the game. They need to add in Wars/Out Post Rush (BIG PVP BATTLES) for lower levels from 20-59 Currently you can only Que for BIG PVP battles at level 60 and they need to keep adding more unique quests that people can do to get to 60 some new ones are in the game but if you like quests they need to keep adding in unique quests.
***Update****
1800 hours into the game now. Season Pass has been added into the game. 40$ for a Game that I have gotten 1800 hours out of is 1000% worth it IMO. Lower Level content had been added and more is still on the way! 3v3 Que for lower levels now in the game! Just need OPR for levels 20-59 and All my complaints are being answered from my first review!

The "expansion" dropped. About a month ago. Hype has died down. Currently sitting at 32,505 players on Steam chart. I put "Expansion" in "" because it doesnt really feel like a "Expansion" but they're charging us for there mistakes. I no longer recommend the game due to their choices in direction, the fact that they have mounts locked behind DLC, it's one thing to release story content and quests and such to be locked until DLC purchase. However, releasing something that is QOL an improvement for traveling faster and you lock it behind DLC. It's just a ridiculous display of money grubbing greed. Because they KNOW going into it, it's going to give an unfair advantage to those who have it vs those who don't. Thus, tipping the scales in the balance of the player base. What do I mean by that? Well now you have a pay to win advantage especially in PvP circumstances. If a group of individuals flagged for PvP and you're flagged for PvP run up on you, you can't escape. You can try to run but if they have mounts it's pointless. You're not escaping. They will just mount up and run you down. And this is just one example of the issues with directions they are moving in.

You could say "well just don't flag for PvP" okay well you're basically saying just don't play part of the game that you paid for. Which is ridiculous. There was another game that did this same thing with mounts, not long after it's player-base got so small it had to go from having a box price to play to free to play lol. I see this one going in the same direction.

The game itself on a base level is half-decent, but seems like every choice they make for it's direction they just continuously push it more into the direction of caring more about how much they can squeeze out of you while simultaneously shafting you disrespectfully.

THIS GAME IS FANTASTIC, and I've played almost everything out there.

Great combat. Well-made world. So much to do that you could easily max-level five complete characters and still not have done every quest and activity. Tons of armor and outfits and weapons and other gear. Crafting is still a little grindy (nothing compared to how grindy it was at release), but there are TONS of other ways to get top-level gear. The low level fights quickly become easy, but higher level foes can kill you surprisingly fast with unexpected maneuvers and styles. Even at max level, a solo run through the main story will get your heart racing OFTEN. The story is well-written and voice actors really do a great job bringing their lines to life. The lore is interesting and very deep.

I think this game does not get as much attention as Skyrim, or Elder Scrolls, or Dragon Age, or Dragon's Dogma or any of the other greats of the genre because it was the first Amazon game, and people have a bit of an attitude.

But for an MMO, this is one of the best. Worlds are very busy with lots of players everywhere. Sometimes, during a solo run, you just happen to be headed the same way with the same agenda as another solo. I've had some truly glorious encounters with strangers where we never spoke a word but got the job done as a team before parting ways...each following a separate trail into the mist.

At the time of this review (321 hours of play), I still have several areas I have yet to enter even once. And as far as the many expeditions (group dungeons), I've barely dipped a toe in those waters. Finding a group for expedition runs seems fairly straightforward, but I have yet to try it much. It's a big game, and I haven't gotten into any of the DLC yet.

On top of all of this, lies the various options for PvP and large-group horde-defense modes. PvP can be everything from one-one duels with anyone you run into, to organized 3v3 battles in an arena. For those who want something larger-scale, there are PvP wars for control of the cities between in-game player factions. Another option is the invasion mode, which tasks a large group of high-level players with defending a central castle against a massive 8-wave army of the enemy.

As an added bonus, they have a season-pass system that is actually quite friendly to free-loaders like me. If you care to figure out how the whole system works for leveling your free season pass, you can level up all day every day if you like...completing quests to earn moves on a simple mini-game board. The rewards are generous and useful and don't cost a dime.

This game has improved a lot since its original launch.

The mechanics are generally straightforward and the crafting system is easy to understand, making it perfect as a casual MMO - emphasis on casual. 

I log on, run a few quests and then do an expedition with a group if I have the time, get some cool looking loot which is good enough for me. 

However, I wish the UI wasn't so clunky and "slow". Animations and general world traversal are not the best as well. The mount DLC is well worth the mobility gained, though I wish you didn't have to "grind" the Riding skill so hard for the best speed boost.

Territory control and faction-based opt-in PVP brings back the realm-vs-realm feel from the glory days of Dark Age of Camelot, a game i've fond memories of. New World has huge potential. PvE content feels much better now due to the new player experience update. Survival and crafting elements are engaging and PvP is where the game truly shines.

Partial Update:  I came to play, instead I'm spending a good amount of time looking at load screens.
The stuttering and choppy play (at times) is like no other game I've ever played. 
Revision: upped the resolution to 4k, lock sync to 60fps, there are times when moving or looking around it's not 60fps.

Update:  Well, there have been game play improvements. I've never been one for PvP, really into the PvE.  Still, can't sell items to a vendor, that was one of the biggest turn offs for me.

Update 2: I enjoy the crafting, I will not buy the DLC. One of the memories from release just revisited (roughly) - If another faction takes over the town, it can shut down or lower the crafting stations. I think initially we were forced to join a faction, now you're not. But why? Why should an opposite faction affect my game play when my PVP is 0% and I'm not part of 'any' faction?!

Update 3: Still, you'd think a company this big would solve their latency issues? Ever play Eve Online? Years ago they had issues, and solved them - biggest part was the hardware they were using - They run 1 server, for world wide population. For NW, I can be heading into higher population areas and the screen will just freeze, stops. Know what helps with the latency? Turning off the on screen global chat, switching to area. - revision, never mind, turning off global may not help, and, it shouldn't. I'm 10 minutes into a splash screen trying to teleport to another area.

Update 4: Again, optimization and high latency issues are a real problem here. When I click to play I want to 'play', instead I'm looking at load screens. There's no other multiple player game I own that takes this long to transition to a new area.

With that, I'm still a firm 'NO', expansion content cost more, latency is bad. I'm not running a potato, I work for the cable provider that has the service. I've built computers since the 90's, I know the difference between performance and latency. No vendor to sell loot, at all. Crafting, I do like, I do enjoy that. PVP controlled areas affect the ability to craft, even if you're not in any tribe.

Oh, one last thing. I deleted any characters I had and started a new one. Reached lvl 50, started at this review. Achievement at lvl 50, only 28.2% of players have reached that level. Game is just over 2 years old.. pretty clear it's got a niche set of clientele.

Update 4: So I don't have anything better to do, or, don't feel like it. So the performance issues are resolved but I had to move the game to an SSD. Now running into town full of others isn't an issue.. but still i7-11700KF, 32GB, ASUS Z590-V, RTX 3060 TI - Well over requirements. I'm playing with different weapons combos and just general goof'n off.

Just checked sys requirements, Disk read speed 2500 MB/s, that's 2.5Gb, I know an HDD can't even remotely do that. SSD installed tested @3600

(side note: really odd the low HDD reads seems like latency, Gibb slap for me.
If you run an SSD and have issues then you probably have a bottleneck causing problems. I try to educate folks in game but they get offended quickly. OH, I have an SSD.. okay, what gen? What's your computer specs (or model#).. )
