TL;DR: New World has the engaging gameplay that I've failed to find in other MMOs. Beautiful environments, great music/sound, engaging combat and progression, and fun lifestyle skills make for a genuinely enjoyable game that holds up to many single-player titles that I typically enjoy. 

I really like the idea of MMOs, but in the past year or so it's been hard to find one that really clicks with me. Even if I really like a game's world or community, such as what I've experienced in Guild Wars 2 or LotRO, the traditional tab-targeting combat and skill rotations of most MMOs has never become fun to me. In my life I've primarily played single-player, action-based RPGs with high levels of gameplay and immersion; if the moment-by-moment gameplay of an MMO wouldn't hold up as a single-player game, then it doesn't hold my attention long. (And let's face it, more and more MMOs are being geared toward solo play.)

New World has been a pleasant surprise. The beginner leveling and learning experience has been a joy; I do not feel rushed to get to the endgame content. In fact, this game regularly puts a smile on my face. The environments are diverse and drop-dead gorgeous. The music and sound design are fantastic, and I don't feel the need to put something on in the background like in other games. The combat is engaging; each weapon feels totally unique. Timing and dodges matter. The classless system and cheap respecs allow for deep experimentation and calibration. Gear isn't a linear, "bigger number = better" decision: I have to actually engage my brain and weigh the pros/cons of what synergizes with the weapon/stat combination I'm trying to specialize in. The gathering, refining, and crafting systems are fun and don't feel tacked-on as an afterthought. As I'm out in the wild questing or fighting mobs, organically finding and gathering resources feels like a special treat. The life skills are fun and add enrichment to the game. (I love rhythm games, and New World's music skill is as fun as it is functional.) I haven't done much multiplayer PvE or PvP yet, but the game is populated and feels lively, which is the reason I'm drawn to MMOs in lieu of single-player games.

There are aspects of New World that leave something to be desired. The main story questline leads me to engaging content, but the story itself hasn't gripped me. I unfortunately find myself skipping through well voice-acted dialogue because the text itself doesn't interest me. The game is jam-packed with lore and journal entries lying around, but most of these only seem worth cursory glances. I'd say my attention span is the issue, but I don't have the same problem in a game like Skyrim or Zelda.

New World lacks an East Asia server. This wasn't a problem for me until I recently moved to Japan, and I had to make a new character on the Pacific server. My ping is mid-tier at best and too high to play at worst. Most times, though, the game is playable from here. This may change if I tried to play competitive PvP. 

All in all, this game has become my go-to MMO and has made me forget about the others I've tried. This game just clicks with me.

Its been 2 years since NW was released and after coming back to it I've been pleasantly surprised.

The good :

-The game has changed, its now less laggy, is more friendly to casual players, has less latency problems and is much more fun than it was on release. 

-The early main story questline update was amazing, leveling from 1-45 is much better now and it took me about 5 days ( 55 ish hours) to reach level 65, and it felt like time passed way too quickly. 

-The new dlc (Rise of the angry earth) is a great addition to the game, while it doesnt completely change the world like WOW does, it adds a new area, mounts, the flail weapon, new lvl cap and new trade skills cap. And i think its actually better than what WOW does, instead of changing the whole world they will slowly expand the original world making it bigger and better. Now, for casual players who play about 2-3 hours per day i would definitely give the dlc a try when its on sale, for players like me who play a lof of hours each day its absolutely worth it for the full price.

-The community is an absolute joy to be around, i can count on my fingers how many toxic people i've seen in the game, the players are nice and helpful, there are no stupid questions in my server.

-Insanely good graphics compared to other mmo's

-A ton of content for both pve and pvp players

-An insanely immersive world, you can be whoever you want, however you want. You want to be a crafting junkie and earn by crafting new gear for people? You absolutely can!

-While on the topic of crafting, great crafting! It makes sense and its easy to get into it

-Traveling has never been better after the introduction of mounts but the scenery of new world is amazing, especially brimstone sands where the structures are a sight to see!

-It's not p2w, what else is there to say the only thing you could bring to being p2w is the premium season pass but it doesnt provide anything that you cannot normally get exept for skins

 The bad : 

-Sometimes the movement and combat feels scuffed, your walking animation is faster than how fast you actually walk and its a weird experience

-If you pull too much enemies you can get stuck in a staggered state from all their attacks, this could be easly fixed with a cooldown on pve staggers

-The server cap needs to be made bigger, more players in a server would mean more competition if you want to farm for example but it would also make the world feel much more alive than it already is

-After 2 years there is still no swimming, the lore excuse is pretty poor (some curse of sorts that makes the players unable to swim) they need to add swimming into the game because it just ruins immersion immensly

-Transmog need to be changed, i think its absolutely bullshit for people to not be able to change how they look without transmog tokens

Overall new world has improved, its come a long way and from what i see the devs are trying their hardest to keep the game on its feet, and i respect it, the game is more complete, more immersive and much more fun to play than it was. Its slowly taking the right steps into becoming an amazing mmo.

With that said i will give new world a deserving 8.9/10 if you like mmo's you absolutely need to get this game on sale and i hope to see more good things from the developers. Cheers.

oof where to start.. well as a new player coming back to this game after being in early beta I will say they have made minor improvements at best. This game shows a complete lack of respect for players time and honestly kind of pay to win if you ask me. 

Pro:
-the game looks good
-the mounts were a good addition even though I absolutely hate the mount system in this game. its clunky and essentially forces you to stay on the road, but none the less it was a good addition.
-depending on what you are doing the combat feels good.

Cons:
Oh boy where to start....

-Whomever came up with the artifact acquiring system should straight up be fired. they clearly don't understand the balance between cool ways to obtain and the time to obtain. For example you to get the Pvp spear, you need to kill a PVE mob on a timer that only spawns during the night on a 1.5 hour cycle with the occasional second spawn. that means as a average player who only plays like 2-4 hours a night there is only a possibility for you to kill this boss 1 to 2 a day day if you are lucky... how in any game world does that make sense. You are punished for either not working from home to afk spawn camp or having a family and kids.. not to mention its a PVP WEAPON you get from PVE. Then you have the PVE greatsword that come from a PVP TRACK...... . the fastest Ive been able to do 1 rank in the pvp track is about 50 minutes.. you cannot from my understand unlock the ability to get the artifact items until level 20.. that means I have to do at minimum 20 hours just have the chance to start getting the artifact. I have heard of people doing 50+ more pvp tracks before even seeing the artifact great sword... Not sure who at AGS thought making it acceptable to put artifacts items behind a wall of at minimum of 20 hour to 70-100 hours but they should be fired. as they clearly 1) have no idea what they are doing and 2) clearly can give two craps about their customer and clearly do not respect their time. 

-the crafting system while I assume it gets easier to understand as you go is very very overwhelming for a new player especially at max level. I am not saying you cannot understand it eventually, but at first glance it is really overkill.

- questing has gotten better due to the mounts, but they really need to come up withe some better questing pattern then just literally running back and fourth for hours at time. 

-PVP - they should make outposts available at level 10 and make it a viable way to level. This would get people more acquainted with pvp before hitting level 65 and just not having a clue about any of it.

Overall I am going to give it a couple more years before I try again. it is clear to me the developers mindset is more so how many pointless tasks can we put into this game to keep players in it instead of really giving good content.

What was supposed to be a crafters paradise of an mmo and they go and f'uck it all up.  The game railroads you into shi'tty parts of the game that you'd sooner just ignore.  Hey guys heres an artifact that you have to do quest to unlock the perks, cool idea, oh but wait you have to have chromatic seals to get the last perk slot, and it is locked behind the pvp faction vendor and you have to be max rep, fine grind out my faction rep which is a shi'tty system, then go to look for the crafting mod that I want on the gear, oh its 60k in the trading post, where can I grind it?  ITS in the F'UCKING PVP REWARD TRACK and not at the early parts but the mid to late part......  and if it wasn't bad enough you can ONLY HAVE 5 ARTIFACT quest going at a time and if you abandon the quest YOU LOSE YOUR PERKS THAT YOU ALREADY GRINDED AND UNLOCKED.  So you cant even just get them and leave them partially finished missing the last perk and progress the other artifacts.  Who on the design team though of this cluster f'uck of bull sh'it?  It's not fun, and once again I try to play this game only to meet these progression road blocks that are so asinine.  Why gate crafting progression behind PVP?  the pvp suck, its laggy, buggy dysnc mess and I LIKE TO PVP but it sucks in this game, but to do your artifacts they force you to do it and offer no pve alternative option to complete the artifacts.

After playing about 1000 more hours with my last review i had to re-write it. 


- Good environment and areas
- A lot of copy paste mobs but with new regions there has been a lot of different variations of mobs added
- Very good game if you are NOT playing hardcore. If you are a hardcore gamer and play MMOs in hardcore with long hours this game is not for you. 
- Classless which means you don't have to make another character to play another class/weapon
- Fun PvE content. Dungeons, chest runs etc.
- Decent PvP, i don't like this games PvP much because the lack of movement in this game and healers just rule 3v3 arenas and no decent amount of action is taken against it. Basically if you don't have healer and opposite side has you will %95 lose the arena match
- Open world pvp is lacking
- A lot of optimization issues specially large cities and large scale PvP
- Too much time gating on gearing. If you are hardcore player you will most likely quit due to this. Almost every type of thing gear progression or crafting some items etc. is time gated. Even if you have all the money/resources game tells you that you have to wait a day or few days to craft single item. Devs choose this instead of making the actual content harder which playing longer doesn't bring much to the table. If you are P2Wing and buying coins you can buy other players cooldowns and buy crafted items directly from other players for a fee which game basically forces you to do so. 
- Too much bugs each patch. If you are going to play don't suprise to keep crashing, running into weird bugs. Simply this game is not being tested much before patches releases and this is something that is not new and always happening and they keep players wait too long to fix the bugs. If major patch releases wait at least a month before start playing. 
- Very bad world system for an MMO, the worst. Sometimes they lock servers for transfers so you can't really play with friends and have to wait maybe a month till bunch of players quit and you lose the motivation to play by then. They should simply merge every world and make channel system which we can swap with a small cooldown but its not the case. If you transfer world too much you will be banned from market and trading becareful when you do that. 
- Limited amount of dungeons there is about 9 dungeons that mutates (hard end game content) each week 2 mutations happen and you have to pay coins to swap gems each week or when you wanna play the other mutated dungeon. Because of this you can't use runeglasses which is very improved version of gems that helps a lot but can only be used in PvP not PvE basically costs too much money.
- Lack of creating raw coins. Basically the only way to make coins is trading. Make an item, craft, gather and sell. There is no raw coin gain that is stable. Dungeons give like maybe 300 400ish each run and its same with mutated ones and normal ones which doesnt make sense while you spend 400 coins each run for potions/elixirs so that money is gone. I think they should increase the rate of raw coins in PvP rewards and mutated dungeons which we all have steady income even if all items are not sellable etc. Its weird tbh
- Lack of testing before patches causing bugs/exploits/abuse in PvP/PvE etc. They simply don't test patches enough and no patch ever released is ready for release its just how it is and you need to accept that
- Lack of customer support, if you are in official discord community manager redirects you to amazon support which they either take too long to response or just redirect you to in game feedback or back to discord very poor support.
- Too much desync in PvP and even in PvE. Sometimes hits doesnt register you teleport and teleport back it just happens no fix yet.

Overall this game is good for casual players as you get hardcore you will enjoy this game less.

Look, I've had my fair share of trash MMOs, I've put in hours in games that I feel like are wasted. New World is far better than people are saying. Most the things people bring up mostly haven't played the game in the last 5-8 months or just spamming reviews. I go through the reviews every now and again, as I see the hours these people put in. Some have 13 hours other have over 5k hours, the thing I find funny is they seem very vague. They talk about problems that are new and think they're the same because they're similar to older exploits. There's different ways to break a game and people try to find them. Most the bugs and problems people talk about I haven't noticed. But they talk about the old methods or "things that haven't been fixed" okay, so what hasn't been fixed? Again the reviews are very vague, then others saying they got banned for no reason, or their mother, friend or a friend of a friend that was introduced by a 7th cousin twice removed for the same reason. Even found an account with 9 hours that copied a comment with like 1.5k hours.  

My point being, these people with less than 50 hours are either spammed comments or expected everything to be handed to them like a lot of MMO do these days. While those who negatively comment with 300+ hours are hypocrites. How are you going to not recommend the game when you've played 300+ hours? I mean you must of had some fun if you have that many hours, so why would you lie? The game is $40, most games that cost $70 you'd be lucky to get half that time. Lets not forget it was also just on sale for like $20 or so this past weekend. Not sure people know how to be honest with themselves anymore and just simply hate to fit in. False promises, what false promises? Seems like New World kept up with everything they said while giving even more, plus AGS gave us Brimstone for free. You know what FF14 tried to do with A Realm Reborn? Charge you $30 for the game they spent 2 years fixing and didn't talk about it at all for that 2 years. And it still released with just as many bugs and problems taking another 18 months (1.5 years) to fix and be playable. Final Fantasy XIV isn't new, the game is roughly 13 years old. And people are expecting New World to compete against that in 2 years? Final Fantasy XIV didn't start getting good until it was about 8 years old. So stop saying this game is bad when Final Fantasy XIV nearly made Square Enix go bankrupted 

 There are problems with this game, some are very noticeable and some aren't. I've found a few and reported and seen some change or a step. I'm not expecting AGS to do much, they are trying to make money after all while keeping the game running. Can't really do that if you spend time fixing the game and give no new content at all. But, in compassion to some games, New World has came a long way. It's so easy to list vague problems such as bugs and "false" bans, but playing this game since launch, it's a completely different game. Keeping up in PTS among other changes I can tell you the game is still very fair to play. No pay to win or anything, so people crying about the whole season pass, get over it, it's a cosmetic progression. Kid you not, if you get to level 60 Player exp is worthless, with the season pass player exp from quests is worth doing. People crying about bots, the bots, at least on my server, are few I've ran into maybe 2 while farming for my own mats. So anyone who's saying the game is filled with bots are either lying or searching for them. I have company mates who only farm for the company and they rarely run into bots if at all. So Bots are not a problem anymore. Dupe glitches get dealt with nearly instantly once reported, they even shut down the shop until it's taken care of. And some of the glitches are dealt with. This is by no means a perfect game, again there are problems with the game I wish AGS will fix. But most of it isn't game breaking. You can casually play or you can hardcore play. Some of the problems the game has is the design, I believe they need to remove all the wards and the game will be much better. But aside from personal wants the game is decent. It's fun to play, very fun community and different combat from other MMOs. New World isn't outstanding but it's not a copy and paste, you'll find something you like in the game. Some of my company enjoys the randomness of crafting, spending most their time getting mats just to role BIS gear. You're free to do as you wish, you don't even have to force yourself to burn out. You can just get everything up on your own time, no one expects you to have it all, so you just do you. For an MMO, there's nothing better than that. I recommend this game because unlike most devs. they haven't just tossed it to the fire, Anthem, after promising to make changes. They have and are making many changes. Expecting this game to be as good as others without trial and error is foolish. AGS has learned from their mistakes, even delaying Season 1 because they don't want to release it in a poor state like New World when it first launch. Developing isn't as simple as adding this and changing that, if it was every game would be a masterpiece. I'm not expecting New World to be the greatest MMO, New World is it's own game. And like every game you have to try it to see if you like it. There's plenty to do, ignore the whole "getting to level 60 is annoying" comments, the game has changed a lot and the first 40 levels are kind of a joke to be honest. They've made progressing professions easier, and going to do so once Season 1 is launched. So I recommend to try the game, if it's on sale then buy it if you're not sure. You waste what $20? The game is fun, find a company, make friends, dance like a fool to music, use the proximity chat, ask about things you're not sure about. Don't force yourself to live by people's standards of what's fun. Because I doubt the people who can clear the 'hardest dungeon in 15 minutes' most like has BIS gear for that expiation and try to speed run it. M10 on average is like 25-30 minutes so they're most likely lying. Try it for yourself, don't play it for 30 minutes and complain about walking for one minute. 

For my conclusion, the game has changed a lot. Expecting a honest review is hard. New World is different, it's doing a concept most MMO games only think about doing. Again the game isn't perfect, there is a wall you will hit, but it's not as bad as people say and it will take you a little while to hit that wall. Just look at the 5k+ hours people played and are crying about. 5k hours, 208 days at least of people playing this game, and they finally said their sick of AGS' shit? And most are complaining about nothing or jealous others are successful off this game. The game is fine, it's fun if you allow it to be. My advice, don't force yourself to play just play. If you feel like farming mats farm mats, if you want to try to get your Mutations up then do so. You're free to do as you please, nothing more nothing less. Just be you and have fun. On that note, take care, stay safe and keep hydrated.

(Edit) This comment was before the announcement of the expansion, after the announcement my views of this game has changed. I didn't buy the expansion seeing I would rather spend my money on a full game on sale than an expansion that will give me another 30-40 hours at most. The fact there is content that was in the game, now locked behind the expansion is already a red flag. Sooner than I expected, the game's numbers have dropped, and I expect by the middle of November to be below what it was before the expansion. Sadly this game is now dead, due to the greed of the developers. For 2 years they released subpar events, nothing really fun and even their "raid" content was just a single boss. This is what happens when you have 3/4's of a game and add the last 1/4 in a paid expansion. I had hope for this game, now I must say it's dead. Buy what you want, just know there's better out there.

Some of the mechanics are extremely annoying.  Some stuff in the game make no sense whatsoever, for example there's an encumbrance potion to let you carry more, but strength doesn't increase your capacity. Why not just tie it to strength and if you encumbered you can use a strength potion?  The crafting system is a bit overly complex, but the storage system of having mats spread all over what, 15 different storage sheds is just flat out annoying.  When you craft only the mats in the shed in that particular town are automatically available.  Does this serve any purpose other than to annoy players?

It's kinda fun to run around and hack and slash, and some of the group activities are good fun.  If you're more into PvE than PvP like me it's still a fun game.

Flawless graphics, great controls, great pvp/pve, all around a great MMO. Average styled MMO however, the "any class and weapon" system is a game changer. The combat is the BEST, no auto lock or spam clicking like other MMOs, with that being said, pvp isnt for casuals.
The game is very similar overall to Destiny if Destiny wasn't an fps MMO, Artifacts being exotics, upragding underleveld gear, clans, pvp, open world bosses, raids, crafting. The audio in the game is the best in any game ive heard

What can be worked on is:
- PVP queing for those under lvl 60-65. anything below those levels youll be waiting at least an hour
- Cleaning up the map and highlights over NPCs for side quests, etc,  looks like a cluster F like most MMOs filled with older folks 
- Cleaning up the complicated (at first sight) crafting, the biggest thing I hear from my friends & others that avoid MMOs is always "that looks way too confusing to enjoy" which is why I stayed away from MMOs myself until ESO. Making things look more friendly and understandable for new players would be a game changer while still keeping all the content in, so to those who say "go play COD or something if it looks to confusing" stfu, thats why your favorite MMO is dead.
- Make required side quests like the heartstone or mount more noticeable or easier to find. At least once a day I see someone in chat "How do I get my mount now that i'm lvl 25"
- Enough of the typical "go pick 5 berries for me then come back" quests, ESPECIALLY at the start of the game, this is another reason new players get bored. You don't have fun really, until a few hours into the game.
- Let new players chat rather than waiting 2 days, the game isn't free, bots who spam should get banned faster if thats the cause for this

Other fun things after being max lvl is participating in company's, company wars, pvp, highest lvl expeditions, houses, trading post for rarer items, maxing out skills like mining or fishing

Overall, this MMO is tons better than others. It's not "easy" talking about combat, like most MMOs are. Beautiful design, voice actors, gameplay overall 9/10.
 
Do what No Mans Sky did, devs. Keep working on it consistently with few bugs and few transactions. Don't let this great game fall off in 4 years like the thousands of other MMOs out there. Even bringing this to console with cross play could boost it even more. Worked for ESO, but no cross play also kills it. Yall got the money to do it, so push this mastercraft out there

First Review:

Good game with a lot of potential for improvement. Definitely not bad for an MMORPG in its its first week(as of review time). PVE or PVE content are plenty here. Given that it's just started and already feels solid, I will recommend this game now, even more if the game is optimized further later on. (92 hours @ 1st review time)

Second Review:

Spoke too soon. Should not have reviewed a game in its seemingly extended paid beta release. Bugs are just too much at the moment to ignore. NW will be a good game once they fix all the bugs. At this time, I would not recommend it as I hate to encourage game studios from profiting from buggy games. (350+ hours playtime)

Third Review:

Long overdue third review. NW is now a good game for me. Bugs are less frequent maybe because they improved the Lumberyard/Azoth engine or less people playing, IDK. Bottomline is, there are now less bugs.

Several quality of life changes and regular new content, through seasons release, also made the gameplay much more playable in the long term.

PRO: I don't have a lot of hours into this game but I have to say that this one is something special being that they finally added a mount system. I've been on and off with this game since launch and just immediately got bored leaving auto-run on until I get to the next settlement. Now, I still toggle auto-run but I'm much more engaged with the game than before.

CON: I didn't like was the marketing decisions made by AGS on pay-walling mounts. They should have at least left the accessibility of mounts to all other players for free. Pay-walling mounts sort of makes the game pay-2-win at this point on both PVE & PVP gameplay in terms of player evasion and artifact farming. Allow me to explain.

   -PVE: To expand more on artifact farming without having access to a mount, lets say I wanted the artifact [Scorpion's Sting] that's dropped by Scorpio Supernal located in Brimstone Sands. I get invited to a raid group and I tele to the Cradle's Rest spirit shrine. I load in. Bear in mind that I'm also mountless so I run on the road. When I get there, Scorpio Supernal is already dead.

   -PVP (Influence Race): 
To put it simply...you can get on your mount to evade attacks from oncoming enemy players. For players that don't have mounts, when it's time to fall back in an influence race, your entire team but you get on their mounts, you are pretty much dead as the enemy team overwhelm you with their accessibility to mounts.

In summary, I love this game because I paid $30 for it. So maybe you should too!

This is going to be quite a lengthy review and I really hope that you will give your time to read through it as I want to break down most of the positives that I have experienced this far. I just started playing new world this past week and i'm already in love. I've spent the past few moths been searching for a great MMO to play as they are my favorite genre. For a bit of context, I have played Runescape mainly over the years as well as BDO and ESO, and a bit of WOW. This will be important because it is where I am coming from and will be using for comparisons later down the line.

-=-=-=-=- RANT -=-=-=-=-
I will throw this out there real quick If you are looking through other reviews, I think this next point is absolutely critical and can be deemed as a bit of a rant but I'm going to get this off my chest. This is a game for more casual - mid level players who don't plan on sinking their life savings, potential real world relationships with others, and literal years in-game. You will see that the overwhelming majority of negative reviews are, funnily enough, left by people with THOUSANDS of hours in game. There are people with well over 6000 hours in the game saying that it is garbage and to not play. WHAT!? That is over 250 DAYS IN-GAME, and you say it sucks? you paid 30 dollars for that much game-play and you would not recommend it? Illogical and honestly sad. I am really sorry that these people feel so cheated somehow, but I feel like these reviews are absolutely not critical, and are purely emotion-based. Rant over.

-=-=-=-=- PROS -=-=-=-=-
-Visuals/sound (9/10)
The first thing that will strike you in this game are the visuals, they are absolutely breathtaking and the atmosphere is serene and beautiful. The lighting is colorful and the detail in the textures are amazing and FAR greater than any other MMO i have played to date. The world is charming and the sound design is incredible, and that is not something I ever even think about in games but the sound of mining and hearing reverb from the nearby mountains is actually an amazing level of detail I've never seen before. The music in the game is peaceful when walking through the woods, and epic when in fights.

-Grind/leveling (8/10)
Unlike almost every other MMO that I have played/watched other play, the grind is immense which personally I have never particularly cared about. I have gotten skills in Runescape to level 99 which on average depending on the skill, could take on average 200-400 hours to get fully maxed which in retrospective is aggredious. Not only is that an insane amount of time to not see your loved ones, or do anything productive in your life, more importantly IT IS NOT FUN. you sit there, clicking, filling your inventory with crap you don't want, getting rid of it, and doing that again at nausium for months. In New world however, I find leveling in all types fun and engaging. You have to walk around and collect resources as you find them, and in most scenarios you can level so many things at once, for example - If you go mining and you have a path of ore veins you want to hit, you will more than likely walk past trees you can cut, mobs you can farm, plants to harvest, and all of this will increase levels in other areas while waiting for those veins of ore to re-spawn. Fishing is sort of a fun mini-game to me and is actually somewhat challenging and isn't all brain-dead.

-Questing/story (6.5-10)
The questing in this game is not the most fleshed out, and if you are very story driven and like to indulge yourself with the lore of the world when playing games, you won't have much to grab onto with new world. It is leagues better than it was when the game first launched as far as questing goes, but still falls short. The story line is very confusing for me and not all that interesting. On the other hand, I don't care for the story in any other MMO that I have ever played and I'd say the majority of those who play MMO's fall under that same umbrella. Its just unfortunate that you don'y have much of an option to dive into this aspect of the game for those who would like to.

-Movement/combat (9/10)
The movement in this game is very fluid and feels fantastic, and so does the combat. All of the weapon choices are fun and unique and you aren't locked into any sort of "class" system with your character which allows you to try out different play-st. This game is amazing for those who love to craft the best builds by min/maxing. The enemies are varied with a wide range of different attack styles that you need to learn especially if you plan on doing "expeditions" which is New World's version or raids or dungeons. Speaking of which, those are super fun to go through! Unlike almost any other MMO I have played, the game DOES NOT start at endgame. I've always felt that style of game forces people to rush through the game as soon as possible and to not enjoy the time it takes to get there. With New World, you can take your time to get to end game WHILE still getting to try out lower level versions of these expeditions at just level 25 which I loved since end game PVE is usually my favorite in an MMO. What would make this category a 10/10 for me would be to change the running animation, it moves quicker than the character does and just seems off. I would also say that I wish there were more expeditions, I believe currently there are 10, which considering the age of the game, there wouldn't be 20-30 like other MMO's that have been around for decades, but I would like to see more come into the game soon.

-Money/value/pay-to-win? (8/10)
Almost every MMO nowadays is completely ridden with pay-to-play/ pay-to-win mechanics, so were does New World fall on this list? I would say its actually very surprisingly fair. You the whole game which is hundreds of hours of play easily, for 40$ and if you get it on sale you pay even less than that. The DLC is 30$ and I will get into the good and bad with this soon. There are NO pay-to-win mechanics. You can absolutely play the game as-is since the only in game purchases besides the DLC is a season pass which is 90% cosmetics, and 10% boxes with items/xp boosts. There is also a free season pass that I have been enjoying personally because again, it adds in cosmetics and xp boosts and you don't have to pay anything for it so you really can't complain (yet some choose to).

-Bugs/glitches (7.5/10)
If you heard anything about New World previously, its that it was a complete buggy mess at launch and I can reassure you that two years later, the team seems to have cleaned up a large majority of those bugs. I have actually only encountered a few visual glitches in my time with New World, and one that stopped me from progressing a quest I was in until I went to the game lobby/rejoined the game and it was fixed. As for visual glitches, I personally would consider them very minor offences, considering they won't end your life in game and only last a moment or two. New World has really come a long way since launch in so many ways but there are some bugs you will encounter so just keep that in mind.

-=-=-=- Cons -=-=-=-

The newest expansion is a lot of fun and I had no issue paying the 30$ shortly after picking up the game because at that rate I knew I was invested. , it is almost a re-skin of a small chunk of the map that previously was available to everyone, and that is honestly really stupid to me that they would take something from everyone and put it behind a paywall. This is also the only way to get mounts in-game which again, is kind of a staple throughout the MMO genre and is a bad choice to keep behind a payment. I feel like there are so many better ways to keep what they had previously, and add an extension of the map and tie it in with the story very easily since the theme is "nature taking over". It felt like a huge oversight to me. 

I would give this game an overall (8/10) and would highly recommend to anyone looking for an awesome new MMO.

I've had a lot of fun with this game since launch. 

There's been a long history of really crappy issues(duping and various other exploits that messed up the economy and territories), and a lot of people left because of those issues, but the game seems to be in a solid spot right now, and even when the game was messed up - it was still fun.

For any returning players(like me) that took a long break(over 180 days) - your characters got removed from their servers and are in limbo. You'll have to choose a server when you come back - make sure that if you were using a company bank to store excess gold in that you choose the same server you were originally on, or else you will lose your company. I almost lost millions of gold by not realizing this. If your server no longer exists, you'll have to find out what server it was merged into.

I do not know how good the game is currently, but I remember how it was 2 months after launch and I will be basing my negative review off of my own personal experiences and the experiences of my Company. Some bugs and glitches early on while not game breaking were funny and eventually got fixed, one example of this was when a friend of mine got banned for milking the cow in the starter city/town right after launch it was funny we all laughed about it and moved on with our lives after Amazon patched the issue and unbanned the people that were wrongfully banned. But there are even more game breaking bugs and glitches  that Amazon struggled to fix after launch that persisted for months because it seemed that every new patch released made them worse. There were even some updates like the one to the crafting system Amazon decide to release after everyone had already maxed their harvesting/ crafting skills that essentially made all of our collective efforts worthless, the bot problem that seems to persist no matter how many time Amazon has claimed to have fixed it. Then there was the toxicity issue where some players went out of their way to bully and harass other players solely because they thought it was funny and the server my friends and I played on saw some of the worst of it because we had big streamers on our server ,Asmongold and TimTheTatman, to name a few. Now  I never had any issues with the two streamers mentioned nor did anyone I know (both helped a few friends of mine with an expedition and were fairly nice) but other streamers leaked the server name to their fans and encouraged them to join the server leading to queues 12+ hours long just to play on the server. The biggest issue we faced due to this was the fact we had some players join the server solely to troll their favorite streamer by spamming things like racial slurs or kekw in chat because they thought it was funny and before you ask me why we stayed, I'll go a head and say it was because some of us had already gotten fairly well set up on the server and didn't want to have to start all over on another server. Now we get to the big issue and the reason why I personally stopped playing the game, Character/ progress lost due to Amazon merging servers and inadvertently deleting peoples' character data, and before you say that , "Amazon fixed that and was able to recover those peoples' character data", Well let me tell you this Amazon in most cases was only able to recover some peoples characters and lost data and the rest of us well all we got was swept under the rug and ignored because it was easier for Amazon to claim they had fixed the issue and recovered all the lost character data. When in actuality they still had hundreds if not thousands of players worldwide who had lost hundreds of hours of progress due to Amazon's incompetence. As it stands I cannot and will not recommend this game to anyone, because in my opinion the game was rushed and incomplete upon initial release, had Amazon taken another year to work most of the issues seen early on out of the game before release they would have seen far more success with the game and the game would be more fun to play.

First off, (I'm Mainly a PvE guy). 

New World has a ton of annoying ass QoL and Gameplay issues... BUT, at the end of the day the game is well worth every dollar you spend on it and here's why. I'm only kinda buzzed i think.

Between the Standard Game price and the Expansion, it's been a great ride lately and I'm not mad about the price tag that followed. This is easily the game that should've been released back in 2021 and Everyone still playing will agree.

Normal full length AAA games are 60-70$ and we all hate that. But if the game is good, it doesn't matter at all. New World is the type of game that'll suck you in and you'll forget all about your Steam Transaction and why you only eat sodium ramen water now. But still, you only spending like 40-60$ for the game and like 20$ a month on ramen, it's kinda legit, buy a house IRL in 2025 or whatever idk whatever.

You'll easily get at least 500 hours out of it if you do all Main Story Quests, side quests, crafting, PvE and PvP.(at least! Some will get 3000 hours because ("Ayee yo, anyone in this world tryna buy a full set of perfectly crafted PvP gear I just crafted with BiS to the moon!!!"). Or something equally as neck beard nerdy as this in game chat.

If you like PvP you'll love it, the fight system is insanely addictive and the abilities/builds can make for fun combat and playability. I have like 0.4k/d in wars and OPR, but it's still so fun and exciting! (But it could use more PvP maps and modes. I bet they are coming sooner than later in updates.)

Finally... At the end of the day, if you like an MMO with a community that seems to always be down to help newer players. Constant large group(20-40) loot/chest runs, expeditions with tier difficulties, PvP with actual aim to damage rewards and terrotiry control gameplay, and a young MMO only getting better with time... Then this is an easy 40$ recommend.

"New World: Where Amazon Delivers Fun in Installments"

Ah, New World, the game that promised to be the Amazon Prime of MMORPGs. I was there at the release, and let me tell you, it was quite the rollercoaster. After playing it for a while, I'm about as excited for their expansion as I am for yet another cardboard box on my doorstep. Buckle up, folks, because it's time for a hilarious, trash-talk-filled review.

Amazon's Promises:

Amazon, you had one job, and it wasn't delivering packages. It was delivering a solid, complete game. But no, they decided to release New World, which was about as complete as a jigsaw puzzle with half the pieces missing. It was like buying a sandwich and getting two slices of bread with a slice of lettuce.

Developers' Shenanigans:

The developers played a fantastic game of "We Promise Fixes Tomorrow." The economy was a mess, the bugs were as numerous as Amazon fulfillment centers, and the PvP was wonkier than a one-legged race. But hey, we got "Coming Soon" patch notes! Who doesn't love empty promises?

Economic Blunder:

Speaking of the economy, it was like a wild stock market crash, but instead of losing money, you lost hours of your life. Crafting materials were rarer than a unicorn, and selling items in the market was like trying to auction off beachfront property in the Sahara Desert. Bravo, Amazon, for turning in-game trading into a bureaucratic nightmare.

PvP Master, Right Here:

Now, don't get me wrong. I was a PvP master in New World. I specialized in the "Run away as fast as I can" strategy. It was like playing hide-and-seek with 60 other kids on a sugar rush, and I was the champ. So, when they announce the expansion, I can't wait to be obliterated by folks who actually understand the combat system.

The Future:

But here's the kicker – despite all the trash talk, I can't help but feel a bit excited about the expansion. It's like waiting for a new season of your favorite reality TV show, hoping they'll fix the mess from the last one. I'm coming back to New World because I believe in second chances, just like Amazon believes in delivering your package two days late but with a smile.

In conclusion, New World had its fair share of hiccups, but it's like that friend who's always late but somehow manages to make you laugh anyway. I'm ready for the expansion, Amazon, so let's see if you can deliver this time, and I don't mean packages.

While I generally first enjoyed the game for a few weeks - it's relaxing with awesome graphics, audio is superb - it is quite frustrating how Amazon Game Studios succeeds in breaking various aspects of this game with just about every other update. Crafting stations stop working, Season Pass breaks, quests don't update or need to be reset AGAIN, etc.
The update files are HUGE and take forever to install. Yet, a few times a week it seems to be a necessity now to repeatedly install patches. Extremely poor QA. May be auspicious NOT to buy the upcoming DLC upon release but instead let it mature for a few months. 

It's equally bewildering how the server issues simply persist. Really sad how the home of AWS can't host New World reliably. Servers constantly crash; players stay away, New World goes dead, servers merge and can subsequently not accommodate a sudden rise in players when seasonal events increase the player base. This happens time after time, AGS has apparently no clue how to adjust for this.

10/03/2023 UPDATE: As predicted, paid $29.99 for the DLC and can't play. Servers overloaded and hour long queues. A total rip-off.

10/09/2023 UPDATE: Still can't play unless sitting in queue for 2 hrs. Finally managed to get 5 mins of play time - disconnected from server when fast traveling. Season pass is broken, does not let you claim rewards. What a total disaster this game turned into.

P.S. Forgot to mention toxicity of the community with unjust "reporting" and misconstrued bans and you realize AGS does not deserve your time / nor money.

when I bought new world, I wanted more than the typical 30-50 hour rpg game. I decided I wanted to try a MMO because I could pay once for access to the game and then enjoy my own adventure with other players in a world being constantly updated with new things, for way more than 50 hours.

Now with about 100 hours into new world I am happy to keep playing and I am still nowhere near the endgame. The combat system is versatile (you can use sword, wooden sword, greatsword, staffs, flail, gauntlets, melee, longbow, axes, and probably more that im forgetting, each with their own abilities) and graphically this game is very strong compared to something like Elder Scrolls Online. There is something really charming about New World. The writing and voicing of NPCs is surprisingly campy and friendly. The game definitely feels alive right now with players and activity.

What I don't like: The name!!! Not really a big deal but I feel like the title "New World" initially has the same kind of vibe of like Second Life and that it will be a life simulator. I am much happier knowing that New World is a pirate fantasy game!

Most of the people complaining about the DLC haven't even given it a chance. Yes the game removes mutated dungeons, yes the flail, mount, and gear score increase are locked behind it, yes the new artifacts are fun and strong. 
That doesn't take away from the game at all. 
- You no longer need to do mutated dungeons as most gear drops at 625 now
- 625 gear is now upscaled in structured PvP to 675, perfectly viable 
- Artifacts, while strong are still in the balancing phase and will be adjusted.
- You do NOT need artifacts to be good or win at PvP, you can be competitive with 625 (675) gear.
- Flail is the first weapon we got that's paid, we got two others and arguably its worse than the Great sword and blunderbuss (despite the use in wars)
- Brimstone was more or less the same size as Elysian and it was free.
- 𝐌𝐎𝐒𝐓 if not 𝐀𝐋𝐋 MMO expansions raise the cap in some fashion. 
- ESO (one of my most played MMOs) always introduce some game altering sets, skills, artifacts with their expansion. They also lock classes behind expansions, which would be like the flail.
- GW2 (probably my favorite MMO at the moment) has elite specializations, locked behind expansions, and those are objectively better than the base game classes.
You could argue you get more bang for your buck and that's a valid criticism. 

The game still has glaring issues, and it still needs a lot of work, despite that, this game is a night and day difference from the launch experience. Its slowly shaping up to be one of the best MMOs on the market. I spent the 30$ on the DLC and have not been disappointed (even though I was reluctant to at first)

Personally the expansion has been a 8/10 for me. I wish the narrative side was a bit stronger, cinematics, lively world etc.. New expedition is great, new mobs, are nice, mount feels really good (Absolutely 𝐂𝐑𝐈𝐌𝐈𝐍𝐀𝐋 that it isn't in the base game, my biggest complaint)
PvP feels great now, a lot of build variety, more perks to use, easier to obtain gear, "New" zone looks pleasing. (It is a sham that they re skinned First Light, i cannot defend that)

Being a MMORPG, every player which wishes to do end-game content needs to complete most of the times the Main Story Quest (MSQ) in order to have access to all the items introduced in the game, for this one particularly, the [b]Azoth Staff Tier V[/b] and also the [b]Heartrune[/b]. [u]BOTH[/u] of these items [h1]ARE NOT ACCESSIBLE FOR THE LAST 3 MONTHS[/h1] prior to the new expansion (see Discord: New World Official - bug reports - T5 Azoth Staff Unattainable - posted 8th of July 2023).
Besides not being able to access these main line quests, you can experience to even lose access to your Azoth Staff Tier IV (which happened to me) and get back only your Tier III Staff.
They increased the server's capacity (a good thing) but the game seems to work a bit worse than before, not gonna lie and on top of that, mobs are spawning ONLY when you are like 2 meters away from them.
Remember, in order to play the game you have to pay 40 Euro ($) and on top of that, if you want to be able to ride a mount (ridiculous the fact it's not free) and have access to the new expansion you need to add 30 Euro ($). All of these to not be able to finish the game properly.

Edit: they fixed the problems.

The game is full of bugs since launch. For a game that is focused around PVP, there is no balance. I don't expect that to ever change. My main focus in a mmo is PVP and Balance and this is by far a shit show for that. The game offers no help in explaining either what is best or worth while investing your time into. Most info you will find is what others are running/youtube. The Arenas/PVP give no stats on what is killing you, or what you did to help attune any build/weaknesses your trying to gear up for. 
They have way over complicated the damage types/what you can do to mix/match that I do not believe this could ever be balanced for any arena mode.

Stuck in a dead server with a toxic 'community' - FORNAX - (avoid at all costs) as it wont allow me to join the more populated ones even tho I have a free world transfer. 

Customer support have not resolved bugged issues on my account 4 days on after them giving me a 2 day time frame. The said 'bugged issues' consist of me having lost progress on my account that I invested many hours (between 50-60) in to obtaining. I of course wish for this to be restored however do not believe it is going to happen at this point. 

Personally don't enjoy the fact that expeditions (Dungeons) are capped when you run the mutated variants, as I had a single build in mind I wanted to obtain and play with, so waited till the mutation that dropped the item I wanted to make the build work came around. By the time I expended all of my runs, the item did not drop... If it wasn't capped, I would happily keep running mutations till it dropped. I have to wait a month at a chance of obtaining the item again now... Nah. 

Entirely lacking the intensives to farm the rest of the build in the meantime as I have no guarantee that it will even drop next month, so what is the point. Consequently, this has entirely disheartened me from continuing to play the game, as hopes of playing it in the style I desire is no longer seeming achievable in a realistic time frame. - I refuse to slog it out another month un-enjoying the game at a glimmer of a hope that I may eventually enjoy a little more. 

A game completely inconsiderate of an individuals time investment to reward ratio - Wish I could refund the DLC.

I really loved this game, addicted even, but now I'm writing this review after more than several times of seeing "You've played for X Hours, Would you recommend" So here it goes.

[Positives]

-Combat-

Absolutely incredible, I love the action combat, I've played all weapons but main a bow / spear (Don't hate me) The feel of it is fantastic, the hit marker noise, the clink/clunk when it lands, satisfying. I main healers or tanks usually on other games, but always loved the archer types, but never stick them out in current MMO's, New world hit that mark for me in a big way. I also tank Mutations, I love the weapon swapping, and general feel of handling your skills.

-Gathering-

Truly immersive, I could blink and hours go by farming, the open world is gorgeous. if you genuinely enjoy gathering in games you'll love this, I even pop PvP on sometimes for abit more risk/fun, its not for everyone and it does have it's downsides.

-The World-

A truly beautiful game, lots to discover, it can be abit samey to some, but it never really felt that way to me. There is a couple hidden things in the world that really make it feel alive and full of history and sentiment. If you haven't yet, check out the shrine in mourningdale dedicated to a dev's wife. Its beautiful and horrible at the same time. It really feels like they care about what they've made.

[Negatives]

-Customer Service-

Awful customer service based on a recent ticket I created with alot of hope in being resolved. I  went to upgrade a named item in the gypsum forge to 700 with 3 perks, I spent 10k on Weapon matrix, 15k on Chromatic Seals + the faction tokens, plus 250 dark matter (11 M1 Gold dungeons excluding the odd scrapped legendary), I wanted to pop on a craft mod for hearty and OFC the forge is bugged, it goes to craft, does nothing, there is a delay, then nothing happens, I was scared it would consume my mats and spit me out nothing, but it didn't luckily, but instead I've had to take the mats to a different forge and somehow, be it my brain or the game, Its instantly gone through the craft and spat out a hot piece of garbage without my desired perk.

I immediately contacted amazon, praying they could do something (In other MMO's GM's would have) They proceeded to take my details, the time of craft, time it was now, exact dates, screenshots/videos, character names, server, it felt like I was being heard and like a resolution was coming, they certainly were looking into it with haste and detail, I get asked to wait 2-3 days, I get a very short email basically saying sorry but no because "it doesn't fall under the Courtesy Service Policy" I've asked what actually falls under, the bottom line is "You are not allowed to know what is in the Courtesy Service Policy". I even get "I'm a gamer too, I've asked if they could just change my perk to the desired one, no. Could I be compensated for the mats? no. I have to wait 3 more days, farm 250 more matter, spend 20-25k more. It might not be alot of gold to others but I'm constantly spending gold so I don't have alot to chuck around that I can just let go and be happy with. I really think there is other crafters that have faced this issue, I don't think it should just be ignored, I think it should be done case by case, if you've crafted an item and left it 1-2 weeks, then maybe that is too bad right? But if your forge is bugged, and I've contacted you immediately, maybe you can just be nice? 

-Character Services-

There is a massive lack of character services at present, and it has been 2 years now. No in-game or outer game customisation changes, i.e hair, face, gender. Just have to re-level and go again.

Transmog is too expensive/gated.

No item restoration

Unclear Courtesy Service Policy - What does it cover? Certainly no miscrafted items.

-Toxicity-

Whilst farming ore or trees, people will message you with threats of their company reporting you for botting if you don't move, claiming its their node and they were there first, insulting you in English and other languages. Simple google translate works, they will also get company members or friends to come help them camp you out.

PvE players will straight up refuse you if you don't run meta, not even a chance, Hense why I tank my own mutations now, given up on playing bow in dungeons (Despite getting my ennead 10 leaderboard with a bow/spear) its not worth the hassle at all. Play spear, greatsword, rapier or you aren't coming - but only 1 rapier is allowed too (understandable due to bleeds).

-"Link gear"-

I hated this at first, link gear, link gems, link trophy's, link consumes, and even if you had the correct trophy's, gems, gear score, even playing meta weapons, they would see a 2 perker piece and decline, it really is minimal. People act like the content is ridiculously hard, I found it quite easy. BUT on the flip side, I've had awful groups that leave you thinking, really? or how on earth? so I do get it, to a degree. This is probably made worse due to the dungeon cap each week. Most wont reach it, but I easily find myself capping the dungeons out every week and it doesn't feel good to lose runs to stupidity or toxicity.

-Dungeon/Mutation rotation/caps-

Having 2 dungeons a week to choose from is mind boggling. I don't understand the limitations to this game, why do I get to choose from 2 dungeons and not them all? The main bother being, if you missed your favourite week, you wont see it again for a month or so. Bad design in my opinion, but AGS have said they are looking at 3 dungeon rotations, so well see. Its very limiting with the old 25 cap now 35 cap too. More players might hit those caps if they didn't have to spam the easiest dungeon that week 35 times for dark matter/gear/gold, whatever the reasons. The PvE dungeon scene in new world feels very gated, by players and by dev's.

-PvP-

 If you run ranged be prepared to be insulted constantly (directly and indirectly) because melee have to chase you and press W, but on the flip side if you run melee you'll get ranged insulting you if you manage to catch them because you'll likely 2-3 shot them. Standard rage I guess, just feels like there is more here. Specially on newer players.

-User interface/Options-

Due to the crafting annoyance earlier written, I don't see why there isn't more alerts in-game when crafting, "NO CRAFT MOD DETECTED" or "ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO CRAFT THIS?". Some more prompts to engage you and make sure these mistakes don't happen, because based on experience now, if you fuck up or bug out, tough shit go again.

When spamming mutations you understandably get flooded with items. I skim over them sometimes to read the stats and make my mind up, whether to lock or scrap. But sometimes I just want to scrap it all fast. When you do this is floods your screen with mats/messages being attained and it gets in the way of the UI/scrapping Yes/no UI, its very very messy, and is a clear oversight and needs a design team / UI team to look into.

-Banking-

The banking system has improved alot since launch but it still fails to hit the mark for me, The weight limits, the unique item restriction, its too much. Personally I'd love to be able to just farm some days, and then dump it all in storage for another day, be it to sell later or craft/level crafting another time, but you can't, 

-Re spec Costs-

I swap specs/attributes out several times a day. If I tank a mutation, 200g. Opr 200g, arena 200g, Open world, 200g, Mistake on my stats, 200g, Magnify/Gear set change, 200g. I must be spending 2k gold a day on respecs at least. I don't believe this should be in the game anymore, it doesn't have a place. Once again punishing players for swapping around isn't good.

Ultimately after my 1,600 hours, I wouldn't recommend it today.

With the recent expansion a lot has changed. And i am highly in favour of the multiple changes. Getting equipment was never as easy.. but it still expects you to play the game.

I am highly in favour of season pass. And paywall content. Like it is done. This is a life action game. That means.. it pays rent and feeds its employees.

The changes that happened with expansion? The mounts behind supposed pay wall? Well.. i not only bought it but paid for currency. Because i trust the road map. 

And yes. The different concerns people bring forth. They try to deliver. They can't satisfy everyone. This is a very mixed community. The perception it was supposed to be this ego shooter pvp wasnt realistic in the end. In the end.. more fantasy friends joined this then anticipated. And they wanted to play in this world. 

Next to the fact.. pvpler were always the most ungrateful bunch considering the changes happening?
Meta changes? Pvplers like "why?" "cry emoji"
Why not server caps at 10000 people? Why not crossplay right now? .... Why are there hard mutations.. why is there PVE content.. pvplers are like " this isnt the game i wanted" but it never was.
They never understood they joined an RPG.

Up to this date New World is working on integrating content so it fits their world. To enable people to enjoy traveling the wilds. To enjoy experimenting with weapons and the crafting system.

And pvplers ... were always like "this is too hard make it easier"

They made changes. They made reasonable changes. But still to this day.. there are people crying over something not dropping today this hour.. because they farmed it for 8 hours and dont own a single luck trophy. Or they did.. and this is the only thing that for RNG reasons just didnt drop as fast.

People are only satisfied when they dont have to play.

<.< On the other hand. As an enjoyer of this world, its concept its possibilities and how they keep wanting to make this the best game for us so that we feel comfortable to pay for their livelyhood.. as well as enjoy the game with us.. I only have love to give to the devs.

This is not like every other game. And people seems to forget what it means to have their own engine. it has its own potential. 

>.> For whats on the market.. For the fact.. they reduced the base game price with new expansion instead of making the same mistake as WOW or ESO.. 

I tap my head.

The amount of bugs? Fuck... any game i enjoy has bugs. I dont know why those are the only games i enjoy though. Maybe i enjoy the potential more then a flawless gameplay. BEcause otherwise i wouldnt have a lot to complain about.

To be precise. They improofed server stability. They improofed pvp Stability. And still people think negatively about q's 

<.< Because this game struggles with player count they have to work with adding and merging servers. And everyone just keeps clinging to servers that dont provide the capacity.

This community was always quite unwilling to change servers. And honestly.. i expected more of people that enjoy a game. 
Although i understand that they cant worry for weeks. But those that worry for weeks to join that one server? I cant understand. 

Numbers back to normal. But there are so many possibilities now.. I am happy. I keep to the roadmap. And i keep believing.

Unfortunately it seems the devs have turned there back on there original model of a 1 time payment mmo and have instead decided to go the payed dlc route.  "oh cool there must be a load of new content and zones".... nope. Not only that, but anyone that doesn't wish to pay for the "dlc" gets completely locked out of end game in all facets now and a zone that we had access to before they moved it behind a paywall. Update 10/15/2023 First Impressions returning to the game after nearly two years away and now playing a few days, changes since 2 years ago:

1. Storage can be freely moved through the user interface, no more running around moving things between different storage locker locations.
2. They removed the 'Expertise System' for gearing! Max level gearing is much easier now!
3. Mounts make the experience better in that you can skip areas easier and move faster, game feels more fun and exciting with mounts running around.
4. There are a lot more quick travel points across the world and the currency to use them is overflowing, even more so with in game perks, the walking simulator is long gone, never have to travel far or for long.
5. I was able to get really good endgame gear through completing the Seasons track, very cool!
6. The game still has bugs, optimization is poor in some areas and have to reset some areas to get npc spawns, some bosses bug and you have to reload or boss is cheesed due to bug.
7. For those that complain about the $30 to play the game in its better state I'd say go play another mmo without a sub monthly and then comeback and complain

Come back and give it a go, I will be playing it awhile in its current form, the graphics are good, my hours played show I've given it a go, I've changed my mind about it. The servers are populated.

In its current state 2 years later I would say it's a lot better compared to my thumbs down review below two years ago, game still has bugs but the devs respond to things, what game doesn't have 'features' you don't like? ;-)

Old  Review 2 years ago 2021:
Primarily a solo player game with group elements that are poorly done and poorly optimized. The world is beautiful and the solo combat is pretty fun, but it's the most buggy game I've ever played at launch. Buggy to the point it has ruined the community and taken the fun out of the game due to the bug exploitation that has heavily ruined the faction balance and supported gold farmers. The game optimization is poor as I have to run my GPU at 90% power and at 90% GPU clock MHz otherwise the game overcook's my GPU. At 90% I'm hitting the 100% mark during spikes from the game. If I run at 100% it will spike at 110% and the game starts to lag out...The game is just very much in a beta state still. Most likely the change up from the original colonial pvp concept to the attempted underworld theme park of what it is now prevented it from being more polished upon release.  I love the world design and the solo combat. I do wish the story-line was a bit more compelling and that the NPC voice-over dialogue worked properly.
Shouldn't tout it as a multiplayer game and then make people do shit solo. Stupid.

Playing New World is a wonderfull experience and i would recomment it to everyone.

The game is in a much better state than on release.

It's a good MMO. It feels active, and there's many different things to do for PvP, PvE, and casual play fans. With the new expansion you can finally get from A to B a little faster with mounts, and the Artifacts are a fun way to introduce you into content you haven't tried but might be fond of.

The price tag might be high, but remember that there's no pay2win at this point. The only things you can buy in the cashshop is cosmetics. Maybe the DLC is p2w but that's for you to debate.

So at it's core I'd recommend this game. You might burn out at 200 hours like I did, or play for 40 hours and be fine with it. Even so, some 80 bucks games will give you even less hours. Even if the combat isn't fun for you, you can go gather and craft. Even if the PvP is too sweaty, you can focus on dungeons. Even if you don't like people, you can go buy a house and decorate it. Or just wander around in a beautiful world full of pretty locations.

Combat is stellar in this game, I will say I wish there was more enemy variety. It all starts to look like the same wolf, pig, undead folk. 

Crafting is fun, there are some definite throttles in crafting, but it's overall satisfying 

I would recommend checking it out, it's good for what it is

I have played many MMOs, both popular and not-so-popular ones, and I must admit that this game offers a refreshing experience. Right from the start, you are greeted by beautiful graphics, an engaging action combat system, a cozy world, great sound design, and interesting features that you won't find in similar games.

However, the game does have its flaws. One major issue is its server structure, with a limit of 3,000 players per server. This falls short when compared to older competing MMOs that have much better solutions. Additionally, the combat and movement mechanics, such as jumping around, can feel clunky at times.

That being said, the leveling experience is very pleasant overall, and I am hopeful that the end game will be just as enjoyable when I reach that stage. In terms of value for money, you'll get the most out of your purchase if you buy the game during a sale. I don't find the standard price horrendous considering the amount of content you receive in this buy-to-play model.

I highly recommend getting your friends into the game so you can enjoy it together, just like I do!

For the price, 100% worth it.

Updated Review: Likes and Dislikes

Like: The game is good, the mount system and artifacts have brought a lot to the game, but beyond all that the reason I'm staying for a longer term this time is because they made open world PVP a reality. People in open world pvp drop items (not their own items, it's like a killing a mob). Depending on how long they've been flagged, the item they drop will be better. This is what I'm excited for, and the reason I'm playing hard to get max geared to open world pvp. 

Dislike: Imagine a game about adventurers (greedy pirates) on a island in the ocean, but there is no water content, and the people can't even swim... It's a bit immersion killing, to be walking underwater as if you won't float. I wanna uninstall every time i fall in water. Also, the combat by using abilities has gotten OK with artifacts that can reduce the CDs, but damn these devs are STUBBORN about using basic attacks. Nearly everyone in the entire community wants *enough* skills so they don't have to basic attack, but the devs are... learning slowly on this one. 

Side note: Gliding Mounts, when? I wanna jump off the top of a mountain gliding on a Wyvern or a Griffon. the graphic in New World are one of the best in the MMO genre, this would add SO MUCH love for the game, just being able to do this. This was my favorite thing to do in Archeage, I really hope New World has something like this one day, before all these other MMOs come out.

I'd highly recommend this game to anyone. Haters will say it's a dead game, but people will always find something to dislike. There's something for everyone in this game, PvE, PvP and a crafting system as well. Also it's classless, so you can be a healer, a tank a DPS and change with ease. Different weapons to learn and master. It's a great game, the one I've played the most by far.

Brand new to New World. The leveling has been pretty decent and you need to also complete some side quests if you are more of a solo player like myself. The main story quest has been fun . I'm level 45 at the time of this writing. 

   Improvements needed are to stabilize the servers and provide more servers. Wanted to do the Halloween event unfortunately you need to be Lvl 60. They need to make it so all players can enjoy events at lower levels. Don't like the PVP factions. seems more about just having more side quests to complete.

   My favorites are being able to ride a horse at level 25 and it has a decent quest to make it more fun and enjoyable. All the combo of weapons  you can use and respeccing is free till lvl 20. Love the fact it's open world with no limits whatsoever except maybe the zone being higher level than you. Fishing is alot of fun and it gives a more real feel to reeling in a fish .You do have to be careful or the line will snap!

Overall rating i would give this game is a solid 8/10 for new players

The game is really amazing but the mobility is REALLY bad (Dodge doesn't always work even when you have enough stamina to perform the Dodge).
Another thing, with the money that Amazon has I find it incredible that the servers are crap! 
A friend of mine on a particular server had to wait 400+ spots to get back into the game after the game randomly crashed.
The game is very badly optimized and will crash randomly. I have an RTX 4070 and my settings are set to High instead of Ultra and have the Framerate cap to 30 and the game STILL crashes randomly.
Not to mention everyone who has a budget GPU can barely play the game, even after lowering all settings to Low.

Another thing I would like to see is Classes. Actual classes. As the system is, you just dump points into whatever is needed for the "build" and it's ok but it could be MUCH better by implementing classes.

Furthermore, we could definitely use "builds" even further by having sets in our inventory. As is, the game allows you to have 2 custom builds/sets of armor but if you go from Ranger to Fighter now you have to respec your character to prioritize Str over Dex. 
It's true that it is very cheap to respec but why not have those stats IMPLEMENTED already as you had them WITH the set/build? Which is why having "classes" can help with that without having to rebuild the game from scratch. I find it crazy that in 2023 this hasn't been thought of in many MMO like games when Neverwinter MMO actually got it right and it's a game from 2009!
Lastly, why is there NO controller support for the game? Using the Steam layout (which I am using), I had to make a working controller for the game and it runs smooth UNLESS you're doing PvP! The problem is that sometimes when you open the map, fast travel, or swap weapons too fast certain functions on the controller stop working. 
It's 2023! These things should be implemented in ANY game nowadays. I find it incredible how so many "gaming companies" don't know this which is why Larian Studios/Baldur's Gate 3 is such a HUGE success story! Stop worrying about how you can get more money from players and worry about how to make the game better and you'll see how the players will more than willing pay EXTRA!
Larian said that they will NOT do any DLC's and I wholeheartedly would pay $100 just for 5 minutes of content from them!

I remember playing this solid for the first 5 days of launch and totally ignoring all the criticism it received until i came to a point where i could no longer be bothered to open steam to play it. Everything was done, end game content didn't exist and i was left just strolling around little outposts while paying rent. Sounds a bit too close to reality and therefore i hit the uninstall button.

Fast forward to Oct 23 and i see all the new juicy stuff the game has to offer with decent reviews advising to re-play the game but in order to enjoy it.. id need to buy the expansion. Ok whatever... lets give it a go. Launch the game that takes ridiculous time to even get to home screen for some unknown reason.. select my character and boom. kicked out for suspicious software. I literally have nothing else on my PC apart from New world, apparently im not the only one with this problem. THANKFULLY i didnt buy the DLC, as upon further investigation, this game somehow has more bugs now than it did at launch......

I'm a casual to moderate gamer with very little MMO experience. That being said, I've been extremely impressed in this games mechanics, graphics, and sound design. There are fairly deep systems but they aren't overwhelming and rarely confusing. I was pleasantly surprised to hear proximity voice chat in the towns. I've had such a good time so far that I went ahead and bought the $30 expansion so I can have a mount when I get there. No big deal since there isn't a monthly fee.

TLDR - I can't speak for hardcore MMO people but if you're the average gamer, this is a great game to get into.
